entry.title: The Snake Lemma
entry.summary: We present a rather general version of the snake lemma for abelian groups.

entry.title: Combinatorial shifting and graded Betti numbers
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn since we combine this paper with math.AC/0503685. All contents of the paper have been moved to math.AC/0503685.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn. All contents of this paper have been moved to math.AC/0503685

entry.title: Etale extensions with finitely many subextensions
entry.summary: We study etale extensions of rings that have FIP.
entry.arxiv:comment: The paper entitled FIP and FCP products of ring morphisms (arXiv: 1312.1250 [math.AC]) is now split into three papers. The present paper contains the last section of the original paper and many other results on etale FIP extensions

entry.title: Resolutions by mapping cones
entry.summary: In this paper we study resolutions which arise as iterated mapping cones.

entry.title: Tight closure and linkage classes in Gorenstein rings
entry.summary: We study the relationship between the tight closure of an ideal and the sum of all ideals in its linkage class.
entry.arxiv:comment: 13 pages to apper in Mathematische Zeitschrift

entry.title: Veronese subrings and tight closure
entry.summary: We determine when graded rings have F-rational or F-regular Veronese subrings, and develop techniques of constructing F-rational rings which are not F-regular.

entry.title: Cohen-Macaulay classes which are not conic
entry.summary: We provide two examples which show that for an affine semigroup ring the set of Cohen-Macaulay classes can be larger than the set of conic classes.

entry.title: Links of symbolic powers of prime ideals
entry.summary: In this paper, we give an affirmative answer to a conjecture raised by Polini and Ulrich.

entry.title: Ideals with maximal local cohomology modules
entry.summary: We characterize the class of ideals of a polynomial ring such that the hilbert series of their graded local cohomology modules is maximal.

entry.title: Zur Affinitaet von Hyperflaechenkomplementen in affinen und projektiven Schemata
entry.summary: We study complements of hypersurfaces in schemes with respect to the property being affine.

entry.title: Minimal generating sets for the first syzygies of a monomial ideal
entry.summary: Two minimal generating sets of the first syzygies of a monomial ideal are produced, given the minimal generating set of the ideal.

entry.title: Normalisation of a Poisson algebra is Poisson
entry.summary: We prove that the integral closure of a Poisson algebra $A$ over a field of characteristic 0 is again a Poisson algebra.

entry.title: Level rings arising from meet-distributive meet-semilattices
entry.summary: The Alexander dual of an arbitrary meet-semilattice is described explicitly. Meet-distributive meet-semilattices whose Alexander dual is level are characterized.

entry.title: Monomial ideals arising from distributive lattices
entry.summary: The free resolution and the Alexander dual of squarefree monomial ideals associated with certain subsets of distributive lattices are studied.

entry.title: The Hilbert series of algebras of Veronese type
entry.summary: This paper gives a fairly explicit formula for the Hilbert series of algebras of Veronese type.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in Communications in Algebra

entry.title: Another proof of global $F$-regularity of Schubert varieties
entry.summary: Recently, Lauritzen, Raben-Pedersen and Thomsen proved that Schubert varieties are globally $F$-regular. We give another proof.

entry.title: Cohen-Macaulay Polymatroidal Ideals
entry.summary: All Cohen--Macaulay polymatroidal ideals are classified. The Cohen--Macaulay polymatroidal ideals are precisely the principal ideals, the Veronese ideals, and the squarefree Veronese ideals.

entry.title: On the radical of a monomial ideal
entry.summary: Algebraic and combinatorial properties of a monomial ideal and its radical are compared.

entry.title: The group of automorphisms of semigroup End
entry.summary: In this paper is proved that the group of automorphisms of semigroup End(P[X]), if P is algebraically closed field, is generated by semi-inner automorphisms.

entry.title: Counting monomials
entry.summary: This paper presents two enumeration techniques based on Hilbert functions. The paper illustrates these techniques by solving two chessboard problems.

entry.title: Notes on the multiplicity conjecture
entry.summary: New cases of the multiplicity conjecture are considered.

entry.title: Comparison of certain complexes of modules of generalized fractions and Cech complexes
entry.summary: We establish an explicit quasi-isomophism of complexes, which is homogeneous in graded situation, from a given Cech complex of modules of generalized fractions.

entry.title: Infinite Minkowski sums of lattice polyhedra
entry.summary: We show that certain two-dimensional, integrally closed monomial modules can be uniquely written as a countable product of isomorphic copies of simple integrally closed monomial ideals.

entry.title: Homogeneous Buchberger algorithms and Sullivant's computational commutative algebra challenge
entry.summary: We give a variant of the homogeneous Buchberger algorithm for positively graded lattice ideals. Using this algorithm we solve the Sullivant computational commutative algebra challenge.

entry.title: Chains and families of tightly closed ideals
entry.summary: We prove tight closure analogues of results of Watanabe about chains and families of integrally closed ideals.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in Bull. London Math. Soc

entry.title: A generalization of the Taylor complex construction
entry.summary: Given multigraded free resolutions of two monomial ideals we construct a multigraded free resolution of the sum of the two ideals.

entry.title: Permanental ideals of Hankel matrices
entry.summary: We provide the Grobner basis and the primary decomposition of the ideals generated by 2 by 2 permanents of Hankel matrices.

entry.title: On the arithmetical rank of an intersection of ideals
entry.summary: We determine sets of elements which, under certain conditions, generate an intersection of ideals up to radical.

entry.title: A Note On Gorenstein Injective Dimension
entry.summary: The Chouinard's formula for injective dimension is extended to the Gorenstein injective dimension.

entry.title: A note on the edge ideals of Ferrers graphs
entry.summary: We determine the arithmetical rank of every edge ideal of a Ferrers graph.

entry.title: Generalized subresultants and generalized subresultant algorithm
entry.summary: In this paper we present the notions of trail (pseudo-)division, generalized subresultants and generalized subresultant algorithm.

entry.title: On the arithmetical rank of certain monomial ideals
entry.summary: We determine a new technique which allows the computation of the arithmetical rank of certain monomial ideals.

entry.title: Genera of zero-divisor graphs with respect to ideals
entry.summary: In this paper, we study the genera of zero-divisor graphs with respect to ideals in finite rings.

entry.title: Arithmetical ranks of Stanley-Reisner ideals via linear algebra
entry.summary: We present some examples of squarefree monomial ideals whose arithmetical rank can be computed using linear algebraic considerations.

entry.title: A short note on containment of cores
entry.summary: We show that cores of ideals do not preserve the inclusion.

entry.title: Bounds for Hilbert coefficients
entry.summary: We compute the Hilbert coefficients of a graded module with pure resolution and discuss lower and upper bounds for these coefficients for arbitrary graded modules.

entry.title: A generalization of the Shestakov-Umirbaev inequality
entry.summary: We give a generalization of the Shestakov-Umirbaev inequality which plays an important role in their solution of the tame generators conjecture.

entry.title: Stanley Decompositions, Pretty Clean Filtrations and Reductions Modulo Regular Elements
entry.summary: We study the behavior of Stanley decompositions and of pretty clean filtrations under reduction modulo a regular element.

entry.title: Contracting Endomorphisms and Gorenstein Modules
entry.summary: We characterize Gorenstein modules over those local rings that admit a finite contracting endomorphism.

entry.title: Constructible ideals
entry.summary: We introduce the concept of constructible ideal and we relate this concept with the notion of constructible simplicial complex. Several properties of constructible ideals are studied.

entry.title: Invarianten zusammenhängender Gruppen und die Cohen-Macaulay Eigenschaft
entry.summary: For G=SL_n or GL_n we construct representations V such that the invariant ring K[V]^G is not Cohen-Macaulay.

entry.title: Konstruktion von Invariantenringen ohne die Cohen-Macaulay Eigenschaft
entry.summary: We give examples of Non-Cohen-Macaulay invariant rings.

entry.title: The Lex-Plus-Powers Conjecture holds for pure powers
entry.summary: We prove Evans' Lex-Plus-Powers Conjecture for ideals containing a monomial regular sequence.

entry.title: A family of local rings with rational Poincaré Series
entry.summary: In this note we compute the Poincare Series of almost stretched Gorenstein local rings. It turns out that it is rational

entry.title: Some arithmetic properties of matroidal ideals
entry.summary: In this paper, we study various properties of matroidal ideals.

entry.title: The core of ideals in arbitrary characteristic
entry.summary: We prove formulas for the core of ideals that apply in arbitrary characteristic.
entry.arxiv:comment: 14 pages, to appear in Michigan Math. J

entry.title: Stanley decompositions and localization
entry.summary: We study the behavior of Stanley depth under the operation of localization with respect to a variable.

entry.title: Bounding Betti numbers of bipartite graph ideals
entry.summary: We prove a conjectured lower bound of Nagel and Reiner on Betti numbers of edge ideals of bipartite graphs.

entry.title: Classes of Monomial Ideals
entry.summary: In this thesis, we focus on the study of some classes of monomial ideals, namely lexsegment ideals and monomial ideals with linear quotients.

entry.title: Optimal Betti numbers of forest ideals
entry.summary: We prove a tight lower bound on the Betti numbers of tree and forest ideals and a tight upper bound on certain graded Betti numbers of squarefree monomial ideals.

entry.title: Integrally Closed Ideals on Log Terminal Surfaces are Multiplier Ideals
entry.summary: We show that all integrally closed ideals on log terminal surfaces are multiplier ideals by extending an existing proof for smooth surfaces.

entry.title: Properties of Koszul homology modules
entry.summary: We investigate various module-theoretic properties of Koszul homology under mild conditions. These include their depth, $S_2$-property and their Bass numbers

entry.title: Gotzmann lexsegment ideals
entry.summary: In this paper we characterize the componentwise lexsegment ideals which are componentwise linear and the lexsegment ideals generated in one degree which are Gotzmann.

entry.title: An algorithm for computing the integral closure
entry.summary: We present an algorithm for computing the integral closure of a reduced ring that is finitely generated over a finite field.

entry.title: Forcing algebras, syzygy bundles, and tight closure
entry.summary: We give a survey about some recent work on tight closure and Hilbert-Kunz theory from the viewpoint of vector bundles

entry.title: On the Fiber Cones of Good Filtrations
entry.summary: The paper characterizes the multiplicity and the Cohen-Macaulayness of fiber cones of good filtrations in terms of minimal reductions of these filtrations.

entry.title: Necessary and Sufficient Condition for a Set of Matrices to Commute
entry.summary: The necessary and suffcient condition for a set of matrices to commute is given and proven.

entry.title: Gorenstein global dimension of Semi-primary rings
entry.summary: The aim of this paper is the study of Gorenstein global and weak dimensions of semi-primary rings.

entry.title: On Gorenstein global dimension in trivial ring extensions
entry.summary: In this paper, we compare the Gorenstein homological dimension of a ring $R$ and of its trivial ring extension by an module $E$.

entry.title: On $n$-strongly Gorenstein rings
entry.summary: This paper introduces and studies a particular subclasses of the class of commutative rings with finite Gorenstein global (resp., weak) dimensions.

entry.title: Gorenstein Von Neumann regular rings
entry.summary: In this paper, we study the rings with zero Gorenstein weak dimensions, which we call them Gorenstein Von Neumann regular rings.

entry.title: Remarks on non-commutative crepant resolutions of complete intersections
entry.summary: We study obstructions to existence of non-commutative crepant resolutions, in the sense of Van den Bergh, over local complete intersections.

entry.title: Arithmetical rank of Cohen-Macaulay squarefree monomial ideals of height two
entry.summary: In this paper, we prove that a squarefree monomial ideal of height 2 whose quotient ring is Cohen-Macaulay is set-theoretic complete intersection.

entry.title: Projective dimensions of the edge ideals of forests
entry.summary: This paper is currently undergoing revision.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper is currently undergoing revision

entry.title: On the canonical module of Toric Surfaces in $P^4$
entry.summary: Our main result states that for a toric surface in $P^4$ canonical module is always Cohen-Macaulay.

entry.title: Homology, mixed multiplicities and Fiber Cone
entry.summary: In this paper we study the Hilbert coefficients the fiber cone. We also compare the depths of the fiber cone and the associated graded ring.

entry.title: Gotzmann squarefree ideals
entry.summary: We classify the squarefree ideals which are Gotzmann in a polynomial ring.

entry.title: Faithfully flat descent for projectivity of modules
entry.summary: We give a self-contained exposition of the proof of faithfully flat descent for projectivity of modules. This fills a gap in the proof given in the literature.

entry.title: An Approach to the Jacobian Conjecture
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to an erro thereon line -2 of page 4.

entry.title: $n$-strongly Gorenstein rings
entry.summary: This paper introduces and studies a particular subclass of the class of commutative rings with finite Gorenstein global dimension.

entry.title: Stanley Conjecture on intersection of three monomial primary ideals
entry.summary: We show that the Stanley's Conjecture holds for an intersection of three monomial primary ideals of a polynomial algebra S over a field.

entry.title: Invariants of some classes of monomial ideals
entry.summary: In this thesis we are interested in describing some homological invariants of certain classes of monomial ideals. We will pay attention to the squarefree and non-squarefree lexsegment ideals.

entry.title: Wildness of polynomial automorphisms in three variables
entry.summary: We study wildness of automorphisms of a polynomial ring in three variables in detail using the Shestakov-Umirbaev theory and its generalization.

entry.title: Computing Serre's intersection multiplicities
entry.summary: The aim of this note is to describe how to compute the intersection multiplicity defined by Jean Pierre Serre.
entry.arxiv:comment: 09 pages. arXiv admin note: text overlap with arXiv:math/0310448 by different author

entry.title: Plane automorphisms given by polynomials of scattered degrees
entry.summary: We study the plane automorphisms given by polynomials with certain degree decompositions.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages. The author is new to the field, so feel free to make any comments, especially on references

entry.title: On the homology of fiber cone of ideals
entry.summary: In this paper we give a unified approach for several results concerning the fiber cone of ideals

entry.title: Sequentially Cohen-Macaulay mixed product ideals
entry.summary: We classify the ideals of mixed products that are sequentially Cohen-Macaulay.

entry.title: An intrinsic characterization of Picard-Vessiot extensions
entry.summary: We present a characterization of differential Picard-Vessiot extensions which is analogous to the field theoretic characterization of Galois extensions in classical Galois theory.

entry.title: Negativity of the Chern number of parameter ideals
entry.summary: In this paper we survey the results on the negativity of the Chern number of parameter ideals.

entry.title: Leinartas's partial fraction decomposition
entry.summary: These notes describe Leinartas's algorithm for multivariate partial fraction decompositions and employ an implementation thereof in Sage.

entry.title: On test modules for flat dimension
entry.summary: A ring with a test module of finite upper complete intersection dimension is complete intersection.

entry.title: A new proof of the Abhyankar-Moh-Suzuki Theorem
entry.summary: This note contains a complete proof of the Abhyankar-Moh-Suzuki theorem (in characteristic zero case).

entry.title: Decomposition Theory
entry.summary: We give a characterization of decomposition theory in linear algebra.

entry.title: Powers are Golod
entry.summary: Let $I$ be a proper graded ideal in a positively graded polynomial ring $S$ over a field of characteristic 0. In this note it is shown that $S/I^k$ is Golod for all $k\geq 2$.

entry.title: The Betti numbers of Stanley-Reisner ideals of simplicial trees
entry.summary: We provide a simple method to compute the Betti numbers if the Stanley-Reisner ideal of a simplicial tree and its Alexander dual.

entry.title: A note on the subadditivity problem for maximal shifts in free resolutions
entry.summary: We present some partial results regarding subadditivity of maximal shifts in finite graded free resolutions.

entry.title: More properties of almost Cohen-Macaulay rings
entry.summary: Some interesting properties of almost Cohen-Macaulay rings are investigated and a Serre type property connected with this class of rings is studied.

entry.title: On the symmetric and Rees algebras of certain determinantal ideals
entry.summary: The purpose of this paper is to give an elementary proof to the theorem due to Avramov on certain determinantal ideals of linear type.

entry.title: On cohomological dimension and depth under linkage
entry.summary: Some relations between cohomological dimensions and depths of linked ideals are investigated and discussed by various examples.

entry.title: On Zariski's Cancellation Problem in positive characteristic
entry.summary: In this paper we shall show that when k is a field of positive characteristic the affine space A^n_k is not cancellative for any n greater than 2.

entry.title: Differential Operators on Modular Extensions
entry.summary: We determine necessary and sufficient conditions on the ring of differential operators of a finite purely inseparable field extension of positive characteristic for determining whether the extension is modular.

entry.title: Endofunctors of singularity categories characterizing Gorenstein rings
entry.summary: In this paper, we prove that certain contravariant endofunctors of singularity categories characterize Gorenstein rings.

entry.title: Semidualizing Modules and Rings of Invariants
entry.summary: We show there exist no nontrivial semidualizing modules for nonmodular rings of invariants of order $p^n$ with $p$ a prime.

entry.title: Absolute Integral Closure
entry.summary: This paper summarizes three talks given by the author during a PASI conference in Olinda, Brasil

entry.title: Completely m-full ideals and componentwise linear ideals
entry.summary: We show that the class of completely m-full ideals coincides with the class of componentwise linear ideals in a polynomial ring over an infinite field.

entry.title: Syzygies of Hibi rings
entry.summary: We survey recent results on resolutions of Hibi rings.

entry.title: Multigraded Betti numbers of some path ideals
entry.summary: We determine (multi)graded Betti numbers of path ideals of lines and star graphs.

entry.title: A note on the Annihilator of local cohomology modules in characteristic zero
entry.summary: We give an alternative proof to the annihilator of local cohomology in characteristic zero which was proved by Lyubeznik.

entry.title: Inverse-syst.lib, Singular library for computing Macaulay's inverse systems
entry.summary: In this note we review the Singular library Inverse-syst.lib that implements Macaulay's correspondence and other related constructions for local rings.

entry.title: Ideals generated by $2$--minors of Hankel matrices
entry.summary: We study ideals generated by $2$--minors of generic Hankel matrices.

entry.title: Around general neron desingularization
entry.summary: It gives some new forms of General Neron Desingularization and new applications.
entry.arxiv:comment: It simplifies the proof of Theorem 10

entry.title: An overview of the computational aspects of nonunique factorization invariants
entry.summary: We give an overview of the existing algorithms to compute nonunique factorization invariants in finitely generated monoids.

entry.title: A one-line undergraduate proof of Zariski's lemma and Hilbert's nullstellensatz
entry.summary: We give an undergraduate short and simple proof for Zariski's lemma.

entry.title: Théorème de de Smit et Lenstra, démonstration élémentaire
entry.summary: We give an elementary and constructive proof for a theorem of de Smit et Lenstra.

entry.title: Rees valuations
entry.summary: We study dicritical divisors and Rees valuations.

entry.title: An observation on generalized Hilbert-Kunz functions
entry.summary: We prove that, under certain assumptions, generalized Hilbert-Kunz multiplicities can be expressed as linear combinations of classical Hilbert-Kunz multiplicities.

entry.title: A Characterization of Gorenstein Planar graphs
entry.summary: We prove that a planar graph is Gorenstein if and only if its independence complex is Eulerian.

entry.title: Monoids with absorbing elements and their associated algebras
entry.summary: Combinatorial and topological aspects of monoids with an absorbing element and their associated algebras are considered. Phd thesis.

entry.title: G-Radical Supplemented Modules
entry.summary: In this work g-radical supplemented modules are defined and investigated some properties of this modules.

entry.title: Closed subgroups of the polynomial automorphism group containing the affine subgroup
entry.summary: We prove that, in characteristic zero, closed subgroups of the polynomial automorphisms group containing the affine group contain the whole tame group.

entry.title: Huneke's degree-computing problem
entry.summary: In this short note, we deal with a problem posted by Huneke on a numerical invariant attached to symbolic powers of homogenous ideals.

entry.title: Some generalizations of second submodules
entry.summary: In this paper, we will introduce two generalizations of second submodules of a module over a commutative ring and explore some basic properties of these classes of modules.

entry.title: On the rigidity of symbolic powers
entry.summary: We deal with the rigidity conjecture of symbolic powers over regular rings. This was asked by Huneke. Along with our investigation, we confirm a conjecture [7, Conjecture 3.8].

entry.title: On the irreducibility of multivariate polynomials
entry.summary: Let (K, v) be a henselian valued field of arbitrary rank. In this paper, we give an irreducibility criterion for multivariate polynomials over K using valuation theory.

entry.title: Construction of Neron Desingularization for Two Dimensional Rings
entry.summary: An algorithmic proof of the General Neron Desingularization theorem is given for $2$-dimensional local rings and morphisms with small singular locus.

entry.title: Powers of Edge Ideals with Linear Resolutions
entry.summary: We show that if $G$ is a gap-free and diamond-free graph, then $I(G)^s$ has a linear minimal free resolution for every $s\geq 2$.

entry.title: Regular Sequences from Determinantal Conditions
entry.summary: In this paper we construct some regular sequences which arise naturally from determinantal conditions.

entry.title: On the $h$-vector of ($S_r$) simplicial complexes
entry.summary: We give a negative answer to a question proposed in [3], regarding the $h$-vector of ($S_r$) simplicial complexes.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in J. Commut. Algebra

entry.title: Cohen-Macaulay binomial edge ideals of cactus graphs
entry.summary: We classify the Cohen-Macaulay binomial edge ideals of cactus and bicyclic graphs.

entry.title: On Switala's Matlis Duality
entry.summary: We show that N. Switala's Matlis duality for $\mathcal D$-modules yields a generalization of a result of R. Hartshorne and C. Polini.

entry.title: Infinite dimensional excellent rings
entry.summary: In this note, we prove that there exist infinite dimensional excellent rings.

entry.title: A Note on Cyclotomic Integers
entry.summary: In this note, we present a new proof that the cyclotomic integers constitute the full ring of integers in the cyclotomic field.

entry.title: Frobenius splitting of Abhyankar valuations
entry.summary: Using a local monomialization result of Knaf and Kuhlmann, we prove that Abhyankar valuation rings of function fields over a perfect ground field of prime characteristic are Frobenius split.

entry.title: Rings and Fields from Semigroups
entry.summary: We introduce a ring and a field, generated by a semigroup, and we investigate some of their properties.

entry.title: Quasi projective dimension for complexes
entry.summary: In this note, we extend the quasi-projective dimension of finite (that is, finitely generated) modules to homologically finite complexes, and we investigate some of homological properties of this dimension.

entry.title: Pointwise minimal extensions
entry.summary: We characterize pointwise minimal extensions of rings introduced by P.-J. Cahen, D. E. Dobbs and T. G. Lucas.

entry.title: The Rees Algebra Package in Macaulay2
entry.summary: This introduces Rees algebras and some of their uses with illustrations via version 2.0 of the Macaulay2 package ReesAlgebra.m2.

entry.title: Monoid rings and ring of polynomials
entry.summary: In this note, the ring of polynomials is introduced in a systematic and standard way.

entry.title: On The Generalized Binomial Edge Ideals of Generalized Block Graphs
entry.summary: We compute the depth and (give bounds for) the regularity of generalized binomial edge ideals associated with generalized block graphs.

entry.title: A new family of ideals with the doubly exponential ideal membership property
entry.summary: Mayr and Meyer found ideals with the doubly exponential ideal membership property. In the analysis of the associated primes of these ideals (in math.AC/0209344), a new family of ideals arose. This new family is presented and analyzed in this paper. It is proved that this new family also satisfies the doubly exponential ideal membership property. Furthermore, the set of associated primes of this family can be computed inductively.

entry.title: B-sequence and approximations of generalized Cohen-Macaulay ideals
entry.summary: We introduce the notion of b-sequence for finitely generated modules over Noetherian rings, which characterizes long Bourbaki sequences. Our main concern is an application of this notion to generalized Cohen-Macaulay approximation, which we introduced lately. We will show how we can construct long Bourbaki sequences of non-trivial type characterizing generalized Cohen-Macaualy ideals by finding suitable b-sequences.
entry.arxiv:comment: This is a largely enhanced version of "Single spot ideals of codimension 3 and long Bourbaki sequences"(math.AC/0303384)

entry.title: Gröbner bases of simplicial toric ideals
entry.summary: Bounds for the maximum degree of a minimal Gr\"obner basis of simplicial toric ideals with respect to the reverse lexicographic order are given. These bounds are close to the bound stated in Eisenbud-Goto's Conjecture on the Castelnuovo-Mumford regularity.
entry.arxiv:comment: Revised version; To appear in Nagoya Math. J

entry.title: D-module generation in positive characteristic via Frobenius descent
entry.summary: In this short note I give an alternative proof of a generalization of the result in math.AC/0407464. Namely I show that for most regular rings R, the localization R[1/f] at an element f of R is generated as a module over the ring of differential operators of R by 1/f itself. Due to the greater generality this answers some questions raised in math.AC/0407464. Some further generalizations and a brief discussion of the main technique (Frobenius descent) are also included.

entry.title: The Index of Reducibility of Parameter Ideals and Mostly Zero Finite Local Cohomology
entry.summary: We prove that if M is a finitely-generated module of dimension d with finite local cohomologies over a Noetherian local ring, and if the ith local cohomology module of M is zero unless i = d, i = 0, and i = r for some r strictly between 0 and d, then there is an integer l such that every parameter ideal for M contained in the lth power of the maximal ideal has the same index of reducibility on M. This theorem generalizes work of the second author (math.AC/0408143) and is closely related to work of S. Goto, H. Sakurai (math.AC/0306148), and N. Suzuki.

entry.title: A counterexample to the rigidity conjecture for rings
entry.summary: An example is constructed of a local ring and a module of finite type and finite projective dimension over that ring such that the module is not rigid. This shows that the rigidity conjecture is false.

entry.title: Taylor and minimal resolutions of homogeneous polynomial ideals
entry.summary: We give a necessary and sufficient condition on a homogeneous polynomial ideal for its Taylor complex to be exact. Then we give a combinatorial construction of a minimal resolution for ideals satisfying the above condition (in particular for monomial ideals).

entry.title: Subalgebras of bigraded Koszul algebras
entry.summary: We show that diagonal subalgebras and generalized Veronese subrings of a bigraded Koszul algebra are Koszul. We give upper bounds for the regularity of sidediagonal and relative Veronese modules and apply the results to symmetric algebras and Rees rings.

entry.title: Asymptotic linear bounds for the Castelnuovo-Mumford regularity
entry.summary: We prove asymptotic linear bounds for the Castelnuovo-Mumford regularity of certain filtrations of homogeneous ideals whose Rees algebras need not to be Noetherian.

entry.title: On Kummer extensions of the power series field
entry.summary: In this paper we study the Kummer extensions of the power series field $K=k((X_1,...,X_n)$, where $k$ is an algebraically closed field of arbitrary characteristic.

entry.title: Minors of symmetric and exterior powers
entry.summary: We describe some of the determinantal ideals attached to symmetric, exterior and tensor powers of a matrix. The methods employed use elements of Zariski's theory of complete ideals and of representation theory.

entry.title: Integral Closures of Cohen-Macaulay monomial ideals
entry.summary: The purpose of this paper is to present a family of Cohen-Macaulay monomial ideals such that their integral closures have embedded components and hence are not Cohen-Macaulay.

entry.title: A Combinatorial Approach to Involution and delta-Regularity I: Involutive Bases in Polynomial Algebras of Solvable Type
entry.summary: General revision. In particular the parts concerning involutive bases over rings have been significantly changed. In addition some proofs have been improved.

entry.title: A cancellation theorem for ideals
entry.summary: We prove cancellation theorems for special ideals in Gorenstein local rings. These theorems take the form that if KI is contained in JI, then K is contained in J.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: J. Pure Appl. Algebra, vol 152, 2000, pp 123--132

entry.title: Hyman Bass and Ubiquity: Gorenstein Rings
entry.summary: This paper is based on a talk given by the author in October, 1997 at a conference at Columbia University in celebration of Hyman Bass's 65th birthday. The paper details some of the history of Gorenstein rings and their uses.

entry.title: Unmixed local rings with minimal Hilbert-Kunz multiplicity are regular
entry.summary: We give a new and simple proof that unmixed local rings having Hilbert-Kunz multiplicity equal to 1 must be regular.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proc. Amer. Math. Soc. vol 130, 2002, pp. 661-665

entry.title: Linear bounds on growth of associated primes
entry.summary: We find explicit bounds on the primary components and on the Castelnuovo-Mumford regularity of powers of monomial ideals. We also analyze the primary decompositions of Katzman's example.

entry.title: Residues for Akizuki's one-dimensional local domain
entry.summary: For a one-dimensional local domain $C_M$ constructed by Akizuki, we find residue maps which give rise to a local duality. The completion of $C_M$ is described using these residue maps.

entry.title: Normal ideals of graded rings
entry.summary: For a graded domain $R=k[X_0,...,X_m]/J$ over an arbitrary domain $k$, it is shown that the ideal generated by elements of degree $\geq mA$, where $A$ is the least common multiple of the weights of the $X_i$, is a normal ideal.

entry.title: A conjecture of Herzog and Conca on counting of paths
entry.summary: A formula concerning counting of paths was conjectured by Herzog and Conca few years ago. Recently, Krattenthaler and Prohaska gave an affirmative answer to this conjecture. In this paper we generalize this formula.

entry.title: On residually S_2 ideals and projective dimension one modules
entry.summary: We prove that certain modules are faithful. This enables us to draw consequences about the reduction number and the integral closure of some classes of ideals.

entry.title: A note on cancellation of reflexive modules
entry.summary: We prove that cancellation of reflexive modules over affine rings holds under some restrictions. We construct examples to show that this is false even over polynomial rings without the extra assumptions.

entry.title: Core of projective dimension onemodules
entry.summary: The core of a projective dimension one module is computed explicitly in terms of Fitting ideals. In particular, our formula recovers previous work by R. Mohan on integrally closed torsionfree modules over a two-dimensional regular local ring.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, to appear in Manu. Math

entry.title: A generalized Dedekind-Mertens lemma and its converse
entry.summary: We study content ideals of polynomials and their behavior under multiplication. We give a generalization of the Lemma of Dedekind-Mertens and prove the converse under suitable dimensionality restrictions.

entry.title: Evaluations of initial ideals and Castelnuovo-Mumford regularity
entry.summary: This paper characterizes the Castelnuovo-Mumford regularity by evaluating the initial ideal with respect to the reverse lexicographic order.

entry.title: Castelnuovo-Mumford regularity: Examples of curves and surfaces
entry.summary: The behaviour of Castelnuovo-Mumford regularity under ``geometric'' transformations is not well understood. In this paper we are concerned with examples which will shed some light on certain questions concerning this behaviour.

entry.title: Cartier isomorphism for toric varieties
entry.summary: In this paper I show that, just as in the smooth case, the Cartier operator induces an isomorphism on the Zariski-deRham complex of any toric variety.

entry.title: Tensor Products of Some Special Rings
entry.summary: In this paper we solve a problem, originally raised by Grothendieck, on the properties, i.e. Complete intersection, Gorenstein, Cohen--Macaulay, that are conserved under tensor product of algebras over a field $k$.

entry.title: Counting of paths and the multiplicity of determinantal rings
entry.summary: In this paper, we derive several formulas of counting families of non-intersecting paths for two-sided ladder-shaped regions. As an application, we give a new proof to a combinatorial interpretation of Fibonacci numbers obtained by G. Andrews in 1974.

entry.title: The height of the mixed sparse resultant
entry.summary: We present an upper bound for the height of the mixed sparse resultant, defined as the logarithm of the maximum modulus of its coefficients. We obtain a similar estimate for its Mahler measure.

entry.title: Heitmann's proof of the direct summand conjecture in dimension 3
entry.summary: We discuss Ray Heitmann's recent proof of the Direct Summand Conjecture in dimension 3 in mixed characteristic. This paper contains a discussion of his methods, a proof of the theorem, and a direct proof of the Canonical Element Conjecture in dimension 3 using his result.

entry.title: On a Theorem of Macaulay on Colons of Ideals
entry.summary: A theorem of Macaulay on colons of ideals in polynomial rings is proved for homogeneous Gorenstein algebras.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, modified version of the paper published in "Contributions to Algebra and Geometry", 2002

entry.title: Skewadjoint operators on pseudoeuclidean spaces
entry.summary: We give a complete classification in canonical forms on finite-dimensional vector spaces over the real numbers.

entry.title: On the computation of Ratliff-Rush closure
entry.summary: Let $R$ be a Cohen-Macaulay local ring with maximal ideal $\max$. In this paper we present a procedure for computing the Ratllif-Rush closure of a $\max-$primary ideal $I \subset R$.

entry.title: Theoreme d'approximation cylindrique dans le cas des anneaux analytiques
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors because M. Aschenbrenner pointed out that the proof of theorem 3.1 was incorrect.

entry.title: Notes on Hilbert-Kunz multiplicity of Rees algebras
entry.summary: In this paper, we estimate the Hilbert-Kunz multiplicity of the (extended) Rees algebras in terms of some invariants of the base ring. Also, we give an explicit formula for the Hilbert-Kunz multiplicities of Rees algebras over Veronese subrings.

entry.title: Rank one Maximal Cohen-Macaulay modules over singularities of type Y_1^3+Y_2^3+Y_3^3+Y_4^3
entry.summary: We describe, by matrix factorizations, the rank one graded maximal Cohen-Macaulay modules over the hypersurface Y_1^3+Y_2^3+Y_3^3+Y_4^3.
entry.arxiv:comment: to appear in NATO Conference Sinaia, Kluwer, Eds Jurgen Herzog and Victor Vuletescu

entry.title: The Lefschetz Property for Componentwise Linear Ideals and Gotzmann Ideals
entry.summary: For standard graded Artinian $K$-algebras defined by componentwise linear ideals and Gotzmann ideals, we give conditions for the weak Lefschetz property in terms of numerical invariants of the defining ideals.

entry.title: Dirac's theorem on chordal graphs and Alexander duality
entry.summary: By using Alexander duality on simplicial complexes we give a new and algebraic proof of Dirac's theorem on chordal graphs.

entry.title: Discrete Polymatroids
entry.summary: The discrete polymatroid is a multiset analogue of the matroid. Based on the polyhedral theory on integral polymatroids developed in late 1960's and in early 1970's, in the present paper the combinatorics and algebra on discrete polymatroids will be studied.

entry.title: Groebner bases, initial ideals and initial algebras
entry.summary: We give an introduction to the theory of initial ideals and initial algebras with emphasis on the transfer of structural properties.

entry.title: Maximal divisorial ideals and t-maximal ideals
entry.summary: We give conditions for a maximal divisorial ideal to be t-maximal and show with examples that, even in a completely integrally closed domain, maximal divisorial ideals need not be t-maximal.

entry.title: On the irreducibility of the determinant of the matrix of moving planes
entry.summary: We show that, for generic bihomogeneous polynomials, the determinant of the matrix of moving planes is irreducible.
entry.arxiv:comment: revised version accepted for publication in Communications in Algebra

entry.title: A generalized Vandermonde determinant
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn while the author verifies the literature.

entry.title: The t#-property for intergral domains
entry.summary: We study a condition on intersections of localizations of a domain at maximal t-ideals. This extends and generalizes earlier work of Gilmer (1967), Gilmer-Heinzer (1968), Olberding (1998), and others for Prufer domains.

entry.title: Cohen-Macaulay injective, projective, and flat dimension
entry.summary: We define three new homological dimensions - Cohen-Macaulay injective, projective, and flat dimension - which inhabit a theory similar to that of classical injective, projective, and flat dimension. Finiteness of the new dimensions characterizes Cohen-Macaulay rings with dualizing modules.

entry.title: A pure subalgebra of a finitely generated algebra is finitely generated
entry.summary: We prove the following. Let $R$ be a Noetherian ring, $B$ a finitely generated $R$-algebra, and $A$ a pure $R$-subalgebra of $B$. Then $A$ is finitely generated over $R$.

entry.title: p-torsion elements in local cohomology modules
entry.summary: We construct an example where a local cohomology module of a hypersurface has p-torsion elements for every prime integer p, and consequently has infinitely many associated prime ideals. We also answer a related question of Hochster.

entry.title: p-torsion elements in local cohomology modules. II
entry.summary: Lyubeznik conjectured that local cohomology modules of regular rings have finitely many associated primes. We examine this conjecture for polynomial rings over the integers, and record some equational identities that arise from studying special cases.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Local Cohomology and Its Applications, Marcel Dekker (2002) 155-167

entry.title: Associated primes of local cohomology modules
entry.summary: This is an expanded version of a lecture on finiteness properties of local cohomology modules given at the 48th Algebra Symposium held at Nagoya University in August 2003.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proceedings of the 48th Algebra Symposium at Nagoya University, (2003) 133-145

entry.title: The Cayley-Menger determinant is irreducible for $n\geq 3$
entry.summary: We prove that the Cayley-Menger determinant of an $n$-dimensional simplex is an absolutely irreducible polynomial for $n\geq3.$ We also study the irreducibility of polynomials associated to related geometric constructions.

entry.title: Cohen-Macaulay chordal graphs
entry.summary: We classify all Cohen-Macaulay chordal graphs. In particular. it is shown that a chordal graph is Cohen-Macaulay if and only if its unmixed.

entry.title: Invariance of a length associated to a reduction
entry.summary: Let $(A, \mathfrak{m})$ be a $d$-dimensional Cohen-Macaulay local ring with infinite residue field and let $J$ be a minimal reduction of $\mathfrak{m}$. We show that $\lambda(\mathfrak{m}^3/J\mathfrak{m}^2)$ is independent of $J$.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages. Accepted for publication in Communications in Algebra

entry.title: The depth of powers of an ideal
entry.summary: We study the limit and initial behavior of the numerical function $f(k)=\depth S/I^k$. General properties of this function together with concrete examples arising from combinatorics are discussed.

entry.title: Rank two Cohen-Macaulay modules over singularities of type $x_1^3+x_2^3+x_3^3+x_4^3$
entry.summary: We describe, by matrix factorizations, all the rank two maximal Cohen-Macaulay modules over singularities of type $x_1^3+x_2^3+x_3^3+x_4^3$.

entry.title: The Ratliff-Rush Closure of Initial Ideals of Certain Prime Ideals
entry.summary: We prove that the initial ideal of the defining ideal of a monomial curve that corresponds to an almost arithmetic sequence of positive integers is Ratliff-Rush closed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages. Submitted to the Rocky Mountain J. of Mathematics

entry.title: On Certain Monomial Sequences
entry.summary: We give equivalent conditions for a monomial sequence to be a d-sequence or a proper sequence, and a sufficient condition for a monomial sequence to be an s-sequence in order to compute invariants of the symmetric algebra of the ideal generated by it.

entry.title: w-Divisorial Domains
entry.summary: We study the class of domains in which each w-ideal is divisorial, extending several properties of divisorial and totally divisorial domains to a much wider class of domains. In particular we consider PvMDs and Mori domains.

entry.title: Deformation theory of modules
entry.summary: Algebraic deformations of modules over a ring are considered. The resulting theory closely resembles Gerstenhaber's deformation theory of associative algebras.

entry.title: Cohomology of truncated polynomial lambda-rings
entry.summary: The lambda-ring cohomology in dimensions 0 and 1 of certain truncated polynomial filtered lambda-rings are computed. The dimension 1 case is related to deformations of lambda-rings.

entry.title: Deformation of algebras over the Landweber-Novikov algebra
entry.summary: An algebraic deformation theory of algebras over the Landweber-Novikov algebra is obtained.
entry.arxiv:comment: Improved Proposition 2.4. To appear in Journal of Algebra

entry.title: Finite Filtrations of Modules and Shellable Multicomplexes
entry.summary: We introduce pretty clean modules, extending the notion of clean modules by Dress, and show that pretty clean modules are sequentially Cohen-Macaulay. We also extend a theorem of Dress on shellable simplicial complexes to multicomplexes.

entry.title: Stanley--Reisner rings with large multiplicities are Cohen--Macaulay
entry.summary: We prove that certain class of Stanley--Reisner rings having sufficiently large multiplicities are Cohen--Macaulay using Alexander duality.

entry.title: On the regularity of local cohomology of bigraded algebras
entry.summary: The Hilbert functions and the regularity of the graded components of local cohomology of a bigraded algebra are considered. Explicit bounds for these invariants are obtained for bigraded hypersurface rings.

entry.title: A short proof of Reisner's Theorem on Cohen-Macaulay simplicial complexes
entry.summary: We present a short proof of Reisner's Theorem, characterizing which simplicial complexes have a Cohen-Macaulay face ring. In some cases, we can also express some homological invariants of the face ring in terms of the reduced homology of the complex.

entry.title: The existence of finitely generated modules of finite Gorenstein injective dimension
entry.summary: In this note, we study commutative Noetherian local rings having finitely generated modules of finite Gorenstein injective dimension. In particular, we consider whether such rings are Cohen-Macaulay.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, to appear in Proc. Amer. Math. Soc

entry.title: On non-standard graded algebras
entry.summary: Positively graded algebras are fairly natural objects which are arduous to be studied. In this article we query quotients of non-standard graded polynomial rings with combinatorial and commutative algebra methods.

entry.title: The strong Lefschetz property and simple extensions
entry.summary: Stanley showed that monomial complete intersections have the strong Lefschetz property. Extending this result we show that a simple extension of an Artinian Gorenstein algebra with the strong Lefschetz property has again the strong Lefschetz property.

entry.title: Resolutions of De Concini-Procesi ideals indexed by hooks
entry.summary: We find a minimal generating set for the De Concini-Procesi ideals indexed by hooks, and study their minimal free resolutions as well as their Hilbert series and regularity.

entry.title: A tropical Nullstellensatz
entry.summary: We suggest a version of Nullstellensatz over the tropical semiring, the real numbers equipped with operations of maximum and addition.
entry.arxiv:comment: One more version of Nullstellenstaz incorporated

entry.title: On ideals generated by monomials and one binomial
entry.summary: We determine, in a polynomial ring over a field, the arithmetical rank of certain ideals generated by a set of monomials and one binomial.

entry.title: Lying-Over Theorem on Left Commutative Rngs
entry.summary: We introduce the notion of a graded integral element, prove the counterpart of the lying-over theorem on commutative algebra in the context of left commutative rngs, and use the Hu-Liu product to select a class of noncommutative rings.

entry.title: On Reciprocity
entry.summary: We prove a reciprocity formula between Gauss sums that is used in the computation of certain quantum invariants of 3-manifolds. Our proof uses the discriminant construction applied to the tensor product of lattices.

entry.title: A note on monomial ideals
entry.summary: We show that the number of elements generating a squarefree monomial ideal up to radical can always be bounded above in terms of the number of its minimal monomial generators and the maximal height of its minimal primes.

entry.title: On the series $\pmb{\sum_{k = 1}^\infty \binom{3k}{k}^{-1}k^{-n} x^k}$
entry.summary: In this paper we investigate the series $\sum_{k = 1}^\infty \binom{3k}{k}^{-1}k^{-n}x^k$. Obtaining some integral representations of them, we evaluated the sum of them explicitly for $n = 0, 1, 2$.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proc. Indian Acad. Sci. (Math. Sci.), Vol. 115, No. 4, November 2005, pp. 371-381

entry.title: Computational algebra and algebraic curves
entry.summary: The development of computational techniques in the last decade has made possible to attack some classical problems of algebraic geometry. In this survey, we briefly describe some open problems related to algebraic curves which can be approached from a computational viewpoint.

entry.title: The Energy of Graphs and Matrices
entry.summary: We extend the concept of graph energy, introduced by Gutman, to matrices. We give upper and lower bounds on matrix energy extending previous results for graphs. In particular, we estimate the energy of almost all graphs.
entry.arxiv:comment: A calculation error fixed. Some more results added

entry.title: Local Duality for Bigraded Modules
entry.summary: In this paper we study local cohomology of finitely generated bigraded modules over a standard bigraded ring with respect to the irrelevant bigraded ideals and establish a duality theorem. Several applications are considered.

entry.title: The dimension of tensor products of k-algebras arising from pullbacks
entry.summary: The purpose of this paper is to compute the Krull dimension of tensor products of k-algebras arising from pullbacks. We also state a formula for the valuative dimension.

entry.title: Failure of tameness for local cohomology
entry.summary: We give an example that shows that not all local cohomology modules are tame in the sense of Brodmann and Hellus.

entry.title: Ring-theoretic properties of PVMDs
entry.summary: We extend to Pr\"ufer $v$-multiplication domains some distinguished ring-theoretic properties of Pr\"ufer domains. In particular we consider the $t##$-property, the $t$-radical trace property, $w$-divisoriality and $w$-stability.
entry.arxiv:comment: 15 pages, to appear in Communications in Algebra

entry.title: Strong Artin-Rees Property in Rings of dimension one and two
entry.summary: In this note we give a simple proof of the fact that local rings of dimension one have the strong uniform Artin-Rees property. Moreover, we give two examples of rings of dimension two where the property fails.

entry.title: Tameness of Local cohomology of monomial ideals with respect to monomial prime ideals
entry.summary: In this paper we consider the local cohomology of monomial ideals with respect to monomial prime ideals and show that all these local cohomology modules are tame.

entry.title: On the arithmetical rank of the edge ideals of forests
entry.summary: We show that for the edge ideals of a certain class of forests, the arithmetical rank equals the projective dimension.

entry.title: Maximally differential ideals in regular local rings
entry.summary: It is shown that if $A$ is a regular local ring and $I$ is a maximally differential ideal in $A$, then $I$ is generated by an $A$-sequence.

entry.title: Cotorsion pairs associated with Auslander categories
entry.summary: We prove that the Auslander class determined by a semidualizing module is the left half of a perfect cotorsion pair. We also prove that the Bass class determined by a semidualizing module is preenveloping.

entry.title: Compactly generated homotopy categories
entry.summary: Over an associative ring we consider a class $\mathbb{X}$ of left modules which is closed under set-indexed coproducts and direct summands. We investigate when the triangulated homotopy category $\mathsf{K}(\mathbb{X})$ is compactly generated, and give a number of examples.

entry.title: On the $S_2$-fication of Some Toric Varieties
entry.summary: Some results on the Cohen-Macaulayness of the canonical module. We study the $S_2$-fication of rings which are quotients by lattices ideals. Given a simplicial lattice ideal of codimension two $I,$ its Macaulayfication is given explicitly from a system of generators of $I$.

entry.title: Integral closures of monomial ideals and Fulkersonian hypergraphs
entry.summary: We prove that the integral closures of the powers of a squarefree monomial ideal I equal the symbolic powers if and only if I is the edge ideal of a Fulkersonian hypergraph.

entry.title: A characterization of modules locally of finite injective dimension
entry.summary: In this note, finite modules locally of finite injective dimension over commutative Noetherian rings are characterized in terms of vanishing of Ext modules.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, to appear in Proc. Amer. Math. Soc

entry.title: On Faltings' annihilator theorem
entry.summary: In the present article, the author shows that Faltings' annihilator theorem holds for any Noetherian ring $A$ if $A$ is universally catenary; all the formal fibers of all the localizations of $A$ are Cohen-Macaulay; and the Cohen-Macaulay locus of each finitely generated $A$-algebra is open.

entry.title: Componentwise linear ideals with minimal or maximal Betti numbers
entry.summary: We characterize componentwise linear monomial ideals with minimal Taylor resolution and consider the lower bound for the Betti numbers of componentwise linear ideals.

entry.title: Regularity of ideals of Borel type is linearly bounded
entry.summary: We show that the regularity of monomial ideals whose associated prime ideals are totally ordered by inclusion is linearly bounded.

entry.title: Generalized complete intersections with linear resolutions
entry.summary: We determine the simplicial compleses $\Delta$ whose Stanley-Reisner ideals $I_\Delta$ have the following property: for all $n\geq 1$ the powers $I_\Delta^n$ have linear resolutions and finite length local cohomologies.

entry.title: A length characterization of $*$-spread
entry.summary: The $*$-spread of an ideal is defined as the minimal number of generators of an ideal which is minimal with respect to having the same tight closure as the original ideal. We prove an asymptotic length formula for the $*$-spread.

entry.title: Regularity and finite injective dimension in characteristic p>0
entry.summary: Recently, the regular local rings of prime characteristic were characterized in terms of the finiteness of injective dimension of the Frobenius map. We obtain relative versions of this result.

entry.title: Monomial ideals with linear upper bound regularity
entry.summary: In this paper, we extend a result of Eisenbud-Reeves-Totaro in the frame of ideals of Borel type. As a consequence, we obtain a linear upper bound for the regularity of a new class of ideals, called $\mathcal D$-fixed ideals.

entry.title: Jordan forms for mutually annihilating nilpotent pairs
entry.summary: In this paper we completely characterize all possible pairs of Jordan canonical forms for mutually annihilating nilpotent pairs, i.e. pairs $(A,B)$ of nilpotent matrices such that $AB=BA=0$.

entry.title: Analytic $q$-difference equations
entry.summary: This paper describes the classification of analytic $q$-difference equations. The difference Galois groups are computed. A tentative description of the universal difference Galois group is given.

entry.title: A stable property of Borel type ideals
entry.summary: In this paper, we extend a result of Eisenbud-Reeves-Totaro in the frame of ideals of Borel type.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages. to appear in "Comunications in Algebra"

entry.title: Some applications of Andre-Quillen homology to classes of arithmetic rings
entry.summary: We compute the first Andre-Quillen homology modules for the simple over-rings of integrally closed domains and study an ideal theoretic condition arising from the vanishing of the first homology module.

entry.title: Local Cohomology and Matlis duality
entry.summary: Matlis duals of local cohomology modules are investigated with respect to many different topics (see section 0 - Introduction). One of these topics are complete intersections - see Corollary 1.1.4.

entry.title: Vertex cover algebras of unimodular hypergraphs
entry.summary: It is proved that all vertex cover algebras of a hypergraph are standard graded if and only if the hypergraph is unimodular. This has interesting consequences on the symbolic powers of monomial ideals.

entry.title: Polynomial Rings Whose Primes are Stci
entry.summary: Let R be a commutative ring with1 and R[X] be the polynomial ring over R. We determine the underlying ring R over which the polynomial ring R[X] has the property that all its prime ideals are set theoretic complete intersections.

entry.title: On Kuroda's proof of Hilbert's fourteenth problem in dimensions three and four
entry.summary: We generalize [3, Lemma 2.2] and [4, Proposition 2.3] and deduce a positive result on Hilbert's fourteenth problem. Further, we give a relatively transparent and elementary proof of [3, Theorem 1.1].

entry.title: Duality and Tameness
entry.summary: We prove a duality theorem for certain graded algebras and show by various examples different kinds of failure of tameness of local cohomology.

entry.title: An algebraic proof of Gabrielov's theorem about analytic homomorphisms in any characteristic
entry.summary: The proof of proposition 3.6 is not correct
entry.arxiv:comment: The proof of proposition 3.6 is not correct

entry.title: A Cohen-Macaulay algebra has only finitely many semidualizing modules
entry.summary: We prove the result stated in the title, which answers the equicharacteristic case of a question of Vasconcelos.
entry.arxiv:comment: Final version; 3 pp. To appear in Math. Proc. Cambridge Philos. Soc

entry.title: Dualities and intersection multiplicities
entry.summary: Let R be a commutative, noetherian, local ring. Topological Q-vector spaces modelled on full subcategories of the derived category of R are constructed in order to study intersection multiplicities.

entry.title: Some result on K-algebras
entry.summary: We give a new proof of the classical result due to Rodney Y. Sharp and Peter Vamos on the dimension of tensor product of a finite number of field extensions of a given field.

entry.title: Stability of associated primes of monomial ideals
entry.summary: Let $I$ be a monomial ideal of a polynomial ring $R$. In this paper we determine a number $B$ such that $\Ass (I^n/I^{n+1}) = \Ass (I^{B}/I^{B+1})$ for all $n\geq B$.

entry.title: Complexity test modules
entry.summary: A method is provided for computing an upper bound of the complexity of a module over a local ring, in terms of vanishing of certain cohomology modules. We then specialize to complete intersections, which are precisely the rings over which all modules have finite complexity.

entry.title: On equimultiple modules
entry.summary: We study the class of equimultiple modules. In particular, we prove several criteria for an equimultiple module to be a complete intersection and prove the openness of the equimultiple locus of an ideal module.

entry.title: On the Frobenius functor and colon ideals
entry.summary: In this paper we study the commutativity of the Frobenius functor and the colon operation of two ideals for Noetherian rings of positive characteristic $p$. New characterizations of regular rings and local UFDs are given.

entry.title: Stanley decompositions of squarefree modules and Alexander duality
entry.summary: In this paper we study how prime filtrations and squarefree Stanley decompositions of squarefree modules over the polynomial ring and the exterior algebra behave with respect to Alexander duality.

entry.title: Tight closure does not commute with localization
entry.summary: We give an example showing that tight closure does not commute with localization.

entry.title: On injectivity of maps between Grothendieck groups induced by completion
entry.summary: We give an example of a local normal domain $R$ such that the map of Grothendieck groups $\G(R) \to \G(\hat R)$ is not injective. We also raise some questions about the kernel of that map.

entry.title: Gröbner bases of simplicial toric ideals
entry.summary: Bounds for the maximal degree of certain Gr\"obner bases of simplicial toric ideals are given. These bounds are close to the bound stated in Eisenbud-Goto's Conjecture on the Castelnuovo-Mumford regularity.

entry.title: Some algebraic invariants of mixed product ideals
entry.summary: We compute some algebraic invariants (e.g. depth, Castelnuovo - Mumford regularity) for a special class of monomial ideals, namely the ideals of mixed products. As a consequence, we characterize the Cohen-Macaulay ideals of mixed products.

entry.title: Multiplicity of Codimension Three Almost Complete Intersections
entry.summary: We establish the upper bound in the multiplicity conjecture of Herzog, Huneke and Srinivasan for the codimension three almost complete intersections. We also give some partial results in the case where I is the aci linked to a complete intersection in one step.

entry.title: A class of transversal polymatroids with Gorenstein base ring
entry.summary: In this paper, the principal tool to describe transversal polymatroids with Gorenstein base ring is polyhedral geometry, especially the $Danilov-Stanley$ theorem for the characterization of canonical module. Also, we compute the $a-invariant$ and the Hilbert series of base ring associated to this class of transversal polymatroids.

entry.title: A Gröbner basis proof of the flat extension theorem for moment matrices
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author since $U$ in Lemma 2 is in general not a subspace.

entry.title: Relative Cohen--Macaulayness of bigraded modules
entry.summary: In this paper we study the local cohomology of all finitely generated bigraded modules over a standard bigraded polynomial ring which have only one nonvanishing local cohomology with respect to one of the irrelevant bigraded ideals.

entry.title: Betti numbers of mixed product ideals
entry.summary: We compute the Betti numbers of the resolution of a special class of square-free monomial ideals, the ideals of mixed products. Moreover when these ideals are Cohen-Macaulay we calculate their type.

entry.title: Constructing Big Indecomposable modules
entry.summary: Let $R$ be local Noetherian ring of depth at least two. We prove that there are indecomposable $R$-modules which are free on the punctured spectrum of constant, arbitrarily large, rank.

entry.title: Complexity of comparing monomials and two improvements of the BM-algorithm
entry.summary: We give a new algorithm for merging sorted lists of monomials. Together with a projection technique we obtain a new complexity bound for the BM-algorithm.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: MMISC 2008, Lecture Notes in Comput. Sci. 5393 (2008), 105--125

entry.title: On the Koszul Betti numbers in positive characteristic
entry.summary: We have observed a gap in one of the arguments in the main theorem. We choose to withdraw the paper until we rectify the gap.

entry.title: When is tight closure determined by the test ideal?
entry.summary: We characterize the rings in which the equality $(\tau I:\tau)= I^*$ holds for every ideal $I \subset R$. Under certain assumptions, these rings must be either weakly F-regular or one-dimensional.

entry.title: Power series over generalized Krull domains
entry.summary: We resolve an open problem in commutative algebra and Field Arithmetic, posed by Jarden -- Let R be a generalized Krull domain. Is the ring R[[X]] of formal power series over R a generalized Krull domain? We show that the answer is negative.

entry.title: Fibonacci Modules and Multiple Fibonacci Sequences
entry.summary: Double Fibonacci sequences are introduced and they are related to operations with Fibonacci modules. Generalizations and examples are also discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: Accepted for publication in ARS Combinatoria, 9 pages, one figure

entry.title: Well, Papa, can you multiply triplets?
entry.summary: We show that the classical algebra of quaternions is a commutative $\Z_2\times\Z_2\times\Z_2$-graded algebra. A similar interpretation of the algebra of octonions is impossible.

entry.title: Bouvier's conjecture
entry.summary: This paper deals with Bouvier's conjecture which sustains that finite-dimensional non-Noetherian Krull domains need not be Jaffard
entry.arxiv:comment: 11 pages. To appear in Commutative Algebra and Applications, Walter de Gruyter, Berlin, Germany, 2009
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Commutative Algebra and its Applications, pages 79-88, 2009

entry.title: Depth and Stanley depth of multigraded modules
entry.summary: We study the behavior of depth and Stanley depth along short exact sequences of multigraded modules and under reduction modulo an element.

entry.title: The projectively resolving of some classes over a direct product of rings
entry.summary: In this paper, we study the resolving of $\mathcal{SGP}(-)$ and $\mathcal{SGF}(-)$, the classes of all strongly Gorenstein projective and flat modules respectively, over a direct product of commutative rings.

entry.title: Divisor class groups of graded hypersurfaces
entry.summary: We demonstrate how some classical computations of divisor class groups can be obtained using the theory of rational coefficient Weil divisors and related results of Watanabe.

entry.title: On Two Results of Mixed Multiplicities
entry.summary: This paper shows that the main result of Trung-Verma in 2007 [TV] only is an immediate consequence of an improvement version of [Theorem 3.4, Vi1] in 2000.

entry.title: Computing Inhomogeneous Groebner Bases
entry.summary: In this paper we describe how an idea centered on the concept of self-saturation allows several improvements in the computation of Groebner bases via Buchberger's Algorithm.

entry.title: Resolution of Unmixed Bipartite Graphs
entry.summary: For an unmixed bipartite graph $G$ we consider the lattice of vertex covers $\mathcal{L}_G$ and compute depth, projective dimension and extremal Betti-numbers of $R/I(G)$ in terms of this lattice.

entry.title: Tight closure's failure to localize - a self-contained exposition
entry.summary: We give a treatment of the Brenner-Monsky example based on polynomial algebra and linear algebra. No prior knowledge of tight closure theory, Hilbert-Kunz theory, algebraic geometry or local cohomology is assumed.

entry.title: Some homological properties of an amalgamated duplication of a ring along an ideal
entry.summary: In this work, we investigate the transfer of some homological properties from a ring $R$ to his amalgamated duplication along some ideal $I$ of $R$, and then generate new and original families of rings with these properties.

entry.title: Gorenstein weak dimension of a coherent power series rings
entry.summary: We compute the Gorenstein weak dimension of a coherent power series rings over a commutative rings and we show that, in general, $\gwd(R) \leq 1$ does not imply that $R$ is an arithmetical ring.

entry.title: Gorenstein global dimension of an amalgamated duplication of a coherent ring along an ideal
entry.summary: In this paper, we study the Gorenstein global dimension of an \emph{amalgamated duplication} of a coherent ring along a regular principal ideal.

entry.title: On growth in totally acyclic minimal complexes
entry.summary: Given a commutative Noetherian local ring, we provide a criterion under which a totally acyclic minimal complex of free modules has symmetric growth.

entry.title: Powers of componentwise linear ideals
entry.summary: We give criteria for graded ideals to have the property that all their powers are componentwise linear. Typical examples to which our criteria can be applied include the vertex cover ideals of certain finite graphs.

entry.title: Local cohomology and F-stability
entry.summary: We study the relationship between the Frobenius stability of an Artinian module over an F-injective ring and its stable part.
entry.arxiv:comment: to appear in Journal of Algebra, minor typos fixed

entry.title: An inequality between depth and Stanley depth
entry.summary: We show that Stanley's Conjecture holds for square free monomial ideals in five variables, that is the Stanley depth of a square free monomial ideal in five variables is greater or equal with its depth.

entry.title: On the Chern Number of an Ideal
entry.summary: We settle the negativity conjecture of Vasconcelos for the Chern number of an ideal in certain unmixed quotients of regular local rings by explicit calculation of the Hilbert polynomials of all ideals generated by systems of parameters.

entry.title: On valuation rings
entry.summary: In this paper we provide necessary and sufficient conditions for $ R=A\propto E $ to be a valuation ring where $E$ is a non-torsion or finitely generated $A-$module. Also, we investigate the $ (n,d) $ property of the valuation ring.

entry.title: On the depth of graded rings associated to lex-segment ideals in $K[x,y]$
entry.summary: In this article, we show that the depths of the associated graded ring and fiber cone of a lex-segment ideal in $K[x,y]$ are equal.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages. To Appear in Beitrage Algebra Geom

entry.title: Inheritance of Properties of Spectra
entry.summary: A mechanism for the inheritance of properties of spectra by differential spectra is developed and applied to prove geometric properties of morphisms of differential algebraic varieties.
entry.arxiv:comment: 15 pages, this version coincides with the published one

entry.title: Face rings of complexes with singularities
entry.summary: It is shown that the face ring of a pure simplicial complex modulo $m$ generic linear forms is a ring with finite local cohomology if and only if the link of every face of dimension $m$ or more is nonsingular.

entry.title: The Stanley-Reisner ideals of polygons as set-theoretic complete intersections
entry.summary: We show that the Stanley-Reisner ideal of the one-dimensional simplicial complex whose diagram is an $n$-gon is always a set-theoretic complete intersection in any positive characteristic.

entry.title: Local dimension of differential algebraic variety
entry.summary: We consider a relation between local and global characteristics of a differential algebraic variety. We prove that dimension of tangent space for every regular point of an irreducible differential algebraic variety coincides with dimension of the variety. Additionally, we classify tangent spaces at regular points in the case of one derivation.

entry.title: The depth formula for modules with reducible complexity
entry.summary: We prove that the depth formula holds for $\Tor$-independent modules in certain cases over a Cohen-Macaulay local ring, provided one of the modules has reducible complexity.

entry.title: Homological dimensions of the amalgamated duplication of a ring along a pure ideal
entry.summary: The aim of this paper is to study the classical global and weak dimensions of the amalgamated duplication of a ring $R$ along a pure ideal $I$.

entry.title: Standard Bases over Rings
entry.summary: The theory of standard bases in polynomial rings with coefficients in a ring R with respect to local orderings is developed. R is a commutative Noetherian ring with 1 and we assume that linear equations are solvable in R.

entry.title: Normaliz: Algorithms for Affine Monoids and Rational Cones
entry.summary: Normaliz is a program for solving linear systems of inequalities. In this paper we present the algorithms implemented in the program, starting with version 2.0.

entry.title: When an amalgamated duplication of a ring along an ideal is quasi-Frobenius
entry.summary: In this paper, we characterize an amalgamated duplication of a ring $R$ along a proper ideal $I$, $R\bowtie I$, which is quasi-Frobenius.

entry.title: The Right Orthogonal Class $\GP(R)^{\perp}$ via $\Ext$
entry.summary: In this paper, we study the pair $(\GP(R),\GP(R)^{\perp})$ where $\GP(R)$ is the class of all Gorenstein projective modules. We prove that it is complete hereditary cotorsion theory provided $l.\Ggldim(R)<\infty$. We discuss also, when every Gorenstein projective module is Gorenstein flat.

entry.title: On Prüfer-like conditions
entry.summary: This paper deals with five extensions of the Pr\"ufer domain concept to commutative rings with zero divisors. We investigate the stability of these Pr\"ufer-like conditions under localization and homomorphic image. Our results generate new and original examples of Pr\"ufer-like rings.

entry.title: Some remarks on orbit sets of unimodular rows
entry.summary: We give a cohomological interpretation of orbit sets of unimodular rows of length d+1 over smooth algebras of Krull dimension d.

entry.title: Homotopical Aspects of Commutative Algebras I: Freeness Conditions for Crossed Squares
entry.summary: We give an alternative description of the top algebra of the free crossed square of algebras on 2-construction data in terms of tensors and coproducts of crossed modules of commutative algebras.

entry.title: Schmitt-Vogel type lemma for reductions
entry.summary: The lemma given by Schmitt and Vogel is an important tool in the study of arithmetical rank of squarefree monomial ideals. In this paper, we give a Schmitt-Vogel type lemma for reductions as an analogous result.

entry.title: On the Hilbert series of vertex cover algebras of Cohen-Macaulay bipartite graphs
entry.summary: We study the Hilbert function and the Hilbert series of the vertex cover algebra $A(G)$, where $G$ is a Cohen-Macaulay bipartite graph.

entry.title: Cubic rings and their ideals
entry.summary: We give an explicit description of cubic rings over a discrete valuation ring, as well as a description of all ideals of such rings.

entry.title: A Property Of Local Cohomology Modules Of Polynomial Rings
entry.summary: Let $R=k[x_1,..., x_n]$ be a polynomial ring over a field $k$ of characteristic $p>0,$ and let $I=(f_1,...,f_s)$ be an ideal of $R.$ We prove that every associated prime $P$ of $H^i_I(R)$ satisfies $\text{dim}R/P\geqslant n-\sum\text{deg}f_i.$ In characteristic 0 the question is open.

entry.title: Minimal generators of toric ideals of graphs
entry.summary: Let $I_G$ be the toric ideal of a graph $G$. We characterize in graph theoretical terms the primitive, the minimal, the indispensable and the fundamental binomials of the toric ideal $I_G$.

entry.title: The Symmetric Algebra for Certain Monomial Curves
entry.summary: In this article we compute a minimal Groebner basis for the symmetric algebra for certain affine Monomial Curves, as an R-module. Keywords: Monomial Curves, Groebner Basis, Symmetric Algebra. Mathematics Subject Classification 2000: 13P10, 13A30 .

entry.title: Singular Points of Affine ML-Surfaces
entry.summary: We give a geometric proof of the fact that any affine surface with trivial Makar-Limanov invariant has finitely many singular points. We deduce that a complete intersection surface with trivial Makar-Limanov invariant is normal.

entry.title: A Remark on the Convolution with Box Splines
entry.summary: The semi-discrete convolution with the Box Spline is an important tool in approximation theory. We give a formula for the difference between semi-discrete convolution and convolution with the Box Spline. This formula involves multiple Bernoulli polynomials.

entry.title: A correction to Epp's paper "Elimination of wild ramification"
entry.summary: We fill a gap in the proof of one of the central theorems in Epp's paper, concerning $p$-cyclic extensions of complete discrete valuation rings.

entry.title: Cohen-Macaulay binomial edge ideals
entry.summary: We study the depth of classes of binomial edge ideals and classify all closed graphs whose binomial edge ideal is Cohen--Macaulay.

entry.title: The nilpotence degree of torsion elements in lambda-rings
entry.summary: It is known that any torsion element in a lambda-ring is nilpotent. In this note we deduce a sharp estimate for the nilpotence degree of such an element.

entry.title: Lambda-conductors for group rings
entry.summary: This paper discusses the lambda-ring version of the notion of conductor ideal for the group ring of a finite abelian group. We prove that if the group is primary, the lambda-conductor is the intersection of the classical conductor and the augmentation ideal.

entry.title: A Note on a Conjecture of Watanabe and Yoshida
entry.summary: We consider a conjecture of Watanabe and Yoshida concerning the Hilbert - Kunz multiplicity of an ideal in a Cohen-Macaulay ring and provide a proof of the conjecture in the case the ring is graded.

entry.title: Topological Constructions for Multigraded Squarefree Module
entry.summary: Let $R=\Bbbk[x_1,\..., x_n]$ and $M=R^s/I$ a multigraded squarefree module. We discuss the construction of cochain complexes associated to $M$ and we show how to interpret homological invariants of $M$ in terms of topological computations. This is a generalization of the well studied case of squarefree monomial ideals.

entry.title: On the Hilbert series of vertex cover algebras of unmixed bipartite graphs
entry.summary: We compute the reduced Gr\"{o}bner basis of the toric ideal with respect to a suitable monomial order and we study the Hilbert series of the vertex cover algebra $A(G)$, where $G$ is an unmixed bipartite graph without isolated vertices.

entry.title: Characterization of Extremal Valued Fields
entry.summary: We characterize those valued fields for which the image of the valuation ring under every polynomial in several variables contains an element of maximal value, or zero.

entry.title: Regularity of Canonical and Deficiency modules for Monomial ideals
entry.summary: We show that the Castelnuovo--Mumford regularity of the canonical or a deficiency module of the quotient of a polynomial ring by a monomial ideal is bounded by its dimension.

entry.title: F4 Algorithm For Euclidean Rings
entry.summary: This short note is the generalization of Faugere F4-algorithm for polynomial rings with coefficients in Euclidean rings. This algorithm computes successively a Groebner basis replacing the reduction of one single s-polynomial in Buchberger's algorithm by the simultaneous reduction of several polynomials.

entry.title: Indices of Normalization of Ideals
