entry.summary: Several numerical indices that control the normalization of ideals are introduced and some relationships among them are derived.

entry.title: Wild hypersurfaces
entry.summary: Complete hypersurfaces of dimension at least 2 and multiplicity at least 4 have wild Cohen-Macaulay type.
entry.arxiv:comment: 16 pages. v2 incorporates referee's suggested revisions; to appear in JPAA

entry.title: Koszul cycles
entry.summary: We prove regularity bounds for Koszul cycles holding for every ideal of dimension at most 1 in a polynomial ring. We generalize the lower bound for the Green-Lazarsfeld index of Veronese rings we proved in arXiv:0902.2431 to the multihomogeneous setting.

entry.title: Invariance of the Barycentric Subdivision of a Simplicial Complex
entry.summary: In this paper we show that a simplicial complex can be determined uniquely up to isomorphism by its barycentric subdivision or comparability graph. At the end, it is summarized several algebraic, combinatorial and topological invariants of simplicial complexes.

entry.title: Sharp upper bounds of the Betti numbers for a given Hilbert polynomial
entry.summary: We show that there exists a saturated graded ideal in a standard graded polynomial ring which has the largest total Betti numbers among all saturated graded ideals for a fixed Hilbert polynomial.

entry.title: Normally torsion-free lexsegment ideals
entry.summary: In this paper we characterize all the lexsegment ideals which are normally torsion-free. Our characterization is given in terms of the ends of the lexsegment. We also prove that the property of being normally torsion-free is equivalent to the property of the depth function of being constant.

entry.title: Two interesting examples of $\mathcal{D}$-modules in characteristic $p>0$
entry.summary: We provide two examples of $\mathcal{D}$-modules in prime characteristic $p$ which answer two open problems in \cite{Lyubeznik} in the negative.

entry.title: Torsion functors of local cohomology modules
entry.summary: Through a study of torsion functors of local cohomology modules we improve some non-finiteness results on the top non-zero local cohomology modules with respect to an ideal.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in Algebr Represent Theor

entry.title: Type sequences of one-dimensional local analytically irreducible rings
entry.summary: We extend the notion of type sequence to rings that are not necessarily residually rational. Using this invariant we characterize different types of rings as almost Gorenstein rings and rings of maximal length.

entry.title: Another definition of Euler class group of a Noetherian ring
entry.summary: We will give another definition of Euler class group of a Noetherian ring.
entry.arxiv:comment: Rocky Mountain Journal of Mathematics (To appear)
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Rocky Mountain Journal of Mathematics, vol 43 (1), (2013), 225-240

entry.title: Resolution of Veronese Embedding of plane curves
entry.summary: Let $C$ be a smooth (irreducible) curve of degree $d$ in $\mathbb{P}^{2}$. Let $\mathbb{P}^{2} \hookrightarrow \mathbb{P}^{5}$ be the Veronese embedding and let $\mathcal{I}_{C}$ denote the homogeneous ideal of $C$ on $\mathbb{P}^{5}$. In this note we explicitly write down the minimal free resolution of $\mathcal{I}_{C}$ for $d\geq 2

entry.title: On Stably free modules over Laurent polynomial rings
entry.summary: We prove constructively that for any finite-dimensional commu- tative ring R, every stably free module over R[X;X^{1}] of rank > dim R is free, i.e., R[X;X^{-1}] is (dimR)-Hermite.

entry.title: A translation: "Every" finite free resolution is a free resolution of an ideal generated by three elements
entry.summary: A translation into English of Winfried Bruns' article: "Jede" endliche freie Aufl\"osung ist freie Aufl\"osung eines von drei Elementen erzeugten Ideals' (published in J. Algebra 39, 429-439 (1976))

entry.title: Equivalence of three different definitions of irreducible element
entry.summary: In this work, we try to draw a comparison among the three different concepts of irreducibility, given by Fletcher, Galovich, Bouvier; these three concepts are equivalent in a particular class of rings, called 'rings with only harmless zero divisors'.

entry.title: State morphism MV-algebras
entry.summary: We present a complete characterization of subdirectly irreducible MV-algebras with internal states (SMV-algebras). This allows us to classify subdirectly irreducible state morphism MV-algebras (SMMV-algebras) and describe single generators of the variety of SMMV-algebras, and show that we have a continuum of varieties of SMMV-algebras.

entry.title: Three simplicial resolutions
entry.summary: We describe the Taylor and Lyubeznik resolutions as simplicial resolutions, and use them to show that the Scarf complex of a monomial ideal is the intersection of all its minimal free resolutions.

entry.title: On Normal-Valued Basic Pseudo Hoops
entry.summary: We show that every pseudo hoop satisfies the Riesz Decomposition Property. We visualize basic pseudo hoops by functions on a linearly ordered set. Finally, we study normal-valued basic pseudo hoops giving a countable base of equations for them.

entry.title: Differential Krull dimension in differential polynomial extensions
entry.summary: We investigate the differential Krull dimension of differential polynomials over a differential ring. We prove a differential analogue of Jaffard's Special Chain Theorem and show that differential polynomial extensions of certain classes of differential rings have no anomaly of differential Krull dimension.

entry.title: Existence of $\partial$-parameterized Picard-Vessiot extensions over fields with algebraically closed constants
entry.summary: The purpose of this short note is to establish the existence of $\partial$-parameterized Picard-Vessiot extensions of systems of linear difference-differential equations over difference-differential fields with algebraically closed constants.

entry.title: Finitistic Weak Dimension of Commutative Arithmetical Rings
entry.summary: It is proven that each commutative arithmetical ring $R$ has a finitistic weak dimension $\leq 2$. More precisely, this dimension is 0 if $R$ is locally IF, 1 if $R$ is locally semicoherent and not IF, and 2 in the other cases.

entry.title: Complexity of multivariate polynomial evaluation
entry.summary: We describe a method to evaluate multivariate polynomials over a finite field and discuss its multiplicative complexity.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Journal of Symbolic Computation, 2013, vol. 50, p. 255-262

entry.title: Gorenstein algebras presented by quadrics
entry.summary: We establish restrictions on the Hilbert function of standard graded Gorenstein algebras with only quadratic relations. Furthermore, we pose some intriguing conjectures and provide evidence for them by proving them in some cases using a number of different techniques, including liaison theory and generic initial ideals.

entry.title: On a Conjecture on the weak global dimension of Gaussian rings
entry.summary: Bazzoni and Glaz conjecture that the weak global dimension of a Gaussian ring is 0,1 or \infty. In this paper, we prove their conjecture in all cases except when R is a non-reduced local Gaussian ring with nilradical $\mathcal{N} satisfying $\mathcal{N}^2=0$.

entry.title: Iterative Differential Embedding Problems in positive Characteristic
entry.summary: In this paper, we prove that every iterative differential embedding problem over an algebraic function field in positive characteristic with an algebraically closed field of constants has a proper solution.

entry.title: Toric Topology. Chapter 3: Commutative and homological algebra of face rings
entry.summary: This is the third chapter in our "Toric Topology" book project. Further chapters are coming. Comments and suggestions are very welcome.
entry.arxiv:comment: Current version of the book is now available as arXiv:1210.2368

entry.title: Toric ideals of finite graphs and adjacent 2-minors
entry.summary: We study the problem when an ideal generated by adjacent 2-minors is the toric ideal of a finite graph.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, 2 figures, Corrected typos, Added explanations and references

entry.title: On the radical of endomorphism rings of local modules
entry.summary: We study the construction and properties of modules whose endomorphism rings have a unique two-sided maximal ideal.
entry.arxiv:comment: 13 pages. Revised version in response to a Referee's report

entry.title: Finite lattices and Gröbner bases
entry.summary: Gr\"obner bases of binomial ideals arising from finite lattices will be studied. In terms of Gr\"obner bases and initial ideals, a characterization of finite distributive lattices as well as planar distributive lattices will be given.

entry.title: Amalgamated algebra extensions defined by Von Neumann regular and SFT conditions
entry.summary: Let $f:A\rightarrow B$ be a ring homomorphism and let $J$ be an ideal of $B$. In this paper, we characterize $R\bowtie^fJ$ to be Von Neumann regular ring and SFT ring, respectively.

entry.title: On a classification of ideals of local rings for irreducible curve singularities
entry.summary: We consider a classification problem of ideals by codimension in case rings are the local rings of irreducible curve singularities. In this paper, we introduce a systematic method to solve this problem.

entry.title: Second syzygies of monomial submodules from walks
entry.summary: This paper has been subsumed as section 2 of our joint paper posted in June 2012.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been subsumed as section 2 of our joint paper posted in June 2012

entry.title: A Schreier Domain Type Condition
entry.summary: We study the integral domains D satisfying the following condition: whenever I >AB with I,A,B nonzero ideals, there exist ideals A'>A and B'>B such that I=A'B'.

entry.title: F-invariants of diagonal hypersurfaces
entry.summary: In this note, we derive a formula for the F-pure threshold of diagonal hypersurfaces over a perfect field of prime characteristic. We also calculate the associated test ideal at the F-pure threshold, and give formulas for higher jumping numbers of Fermat hypersurfaces.

entry.title: Diagonal F-thresholds and F-pure thresholds of Hibi rings
entry.summary: Hibi rings are a kind of graded toric ring on a finite distributive lattice $D = J(P)$, where $P$ is a partially ordered set. In this paper, we compute diagonal F-thresholds and F-pure thresholds of Hibi rings.

entry.title: Essentially Critically Compressible Modules
entry.summary: The main purpose of this paper is to introduce the concept of essentially critically compressible modules. We call an R-module M essentially critically compressible module if it is essentially compressible and additionally it cannot be imbedded in any of its factor module.

entry.title: Bazzoni-Glaz Conjecture
entry.summary: In their paper, Bazzoni and Glaz conjecture that the weak global dimension of a Gaussian ring is $0,1$ or $\infty$. In this paper, we prove their conjecture.
entry.arxiv:comment: arXiv admin note: substantial text overlap with arXiv:1107.0440

entry.title: The join-meet ideal of a finite lattice
entry.summary: Radical binomial ideals associated with finite lattices are studied. Gr\"obner basis theory turns out to be an efficient tool in this investigation.

entry.title: Splitting cycles in graphs
entry.summary: The goal of this paper is to describe a sufficient condition on cycles in graphs for which the edge ideal is splittable. We give an explicit splitting function for such ideals.

entry.title: Construction of Cohen-Macaulay binomial edge ideals
entry.summary: We discuss algebraic and homological properties of binomial edge ideals associated to graphs which are obtained by gluing of subgraphs and the formation of cones.

entry.title: Monomial ideals whose depth function has any given number of strict local maxima
entry.summary: We construct monomial ideals with the property that their depth function has any given number of strict local maxima.

entry.title: On the genesis of a determinantal identity
entry.summary: We show how to derive a $3 \times 3$ determinantal identity in 12 indeterminates that gives an explicit version of a result of Mohan Kumar and Pavaman Murthy on completing unimodular rows.

entry.title: Valuations centered at a two-dimensional regular local ring: Infima and Topologies
entry.summary: The aim of this paper is to prove that every non-empty set of valuations centered at a two-dimensional regular domain has an infimum. We also generalize some results related to a non-metric tree.

entry.title: Corregindium: Krull dimension, Overrings and Semistar operations of an integral Domain
entry.summary: In this note we present a corregindium to our paper "Krull dimension, Overrings and Semistar operations of an integral Domain", Journal of Algebra, 321 (2009), 1497--1509.

entry.title: Upper bounds of depth of monomial ideals
entry.summary: Let $J\subsetneq I$ be two ideals of a polynomial ring $S$ over a field, generated by square free monomials. We show that some inequalities among the numbers of square free monomials of $I\setminus J$ of different degrees give upper bounds of $\depth_SI/J$.

entry.title: On the minimal graded free resolution of powers of lexsegment ideals
entry.summary: We consider powers of lexsegment ideals with a linear resolution (equivalently, with linear quotients) which are not completely lexsegment ideals. We give a complete description of their minimal graded free resolution.

entry.title: Coarsening of graded local cohomology
entry.summary: Some criteria for graded local cohomology to commute with coarsening functors are proven, and an example is given where graded local cohomology does not commute with coarsening.

entry.title: A Note on Formulas Transmuting Mixed Multiplicities
entry.summary: This paper establishes mixed multiplicity formulas concerning the relationship between mixed multiplicities of modules and mixed multiplicities of rings via rank of modules.

entry.title: Regularity bounds for binomial edge ideals
entry.summary: We show that the Castelnuovo-Mumford regularity of the binomial edge ideal of a graph is bounded below by the length of its longest induced path and bounded above by the number of its vertices.

entry.title: Cohen-Macaulay binomial edge ideals of small deviation
entry.summary: We classify all binomial edge ideals that are complete intersection and Cohen-Macaulay almost complete intersection. We also describe an algorithm and provide an implementation to compute primary decomposition of binomial edge ideals.

entry.title: Squarefree monomial ideals with constant depth function
entry.summary: In this paper we study squarefree monomial ideals which have constant depth functions. Edge ideals, matroidal ideals and facet ideals of pure simplicial forests connected in codimension one with this property are classified.

entry.title: Contracting endomorphisms and dualizing complexes
entry.summary: We investigate how one can detect the dualizing property for a chain complex over a commutative local noetherian ring R. Our focus is on homological properties of contracting endomorphisms of R, e.g., the Frobenius endomorphism when R contains a field of positive characteristic.

entry.title: Semi-addivitity and acyclicity
entry.summary: We generalize the notion of length to an ordinal-valued invariant defined on the class of finitely generated modules over a Noetherian ring. A key property of this invariant is its semi-additivity on short exact sequences. As an application, we prove some general acyclicity theorems.

entry.title: Algebraization of a Cartier divisor
entry.summary: We extend to pairs classical results of R. Elkik on lifting of homomorphisms and algebraization. In particular, we establish algebraization of an affine rig-smooth formal variety with a rig-smooth closed subvariety. This solves affirmatively a problem raised by M. Temkin and has applications to desingularization theory.

entry.title: Coarsenings, injectives and Hom functors
entry.summary: It is characterized when coarsening functors between categories of graded modules preserve injectivity of objects, and when they commute with graded covariant Hom functors.
entry.arxiv:comment: to appear in Rev. Roumaine Math. Pures Appl

entry.title: Huneke-Wiegand Conjecture for Complete Intersection Numerical Semigroup Rings
entry.summary: We give a positive answer to the Huneke-Wiegand Conjecture for monomial ideals over free numerical semigroup rings, and for two generated monomial ideals over complete intersection numerical semigroup rings.

entry.title: Reflexivity and connectedness
entry.summary: Given a finitely generated module over a commutative noetherian ring that satisfies certain reflexivity conditions, we show how failure of the semidualizing property for the module manifests in a disconnection of the prime spectrum of the ring.

entry.title: A note on some top local cohomology modules
entry.summary: Let $\fa$ be an ideal of a $d$-dimensional commutative Noetherian ring $R$. In this paper we give some information on some last non-zero local cohomology modules known as top local cohomology modules in particular, $H^{d-1}_{\fa}(R)$.

entry.title: What is special about the divisors of 12?
entry.summary: Let R be the ring of polynomials in finitely many commuting variables with coefficients in Z_n. It is shown that every unit of R is an involution if and only of n is a divisor of 12.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, to appear in Math. Magazine

entry.title: Generalized AG codes as evaluation codes
entry.summary: We extend the construction of GAG codes to the case of evaluation codes. We estimate the minimum distance of these extended evaluation codes and we describe the connection to the one-point GAG codes.

entry.title: Dual F-signature
entry.summary: We define the dual F-signature of modules, which is equivalent to the F-signature if the module is the base ring. By using this invariant, We give characterizations of regular, F-regular, F-rational, and Gorenstein singularities.
entry.arxiv:comment: Typos corrected and other minor changes. To appear in International Mathematics Research Notices

entry.title: Some examples of two-dimensional regular rings
entry.summary: Let B be a ring and $A=B[X,Y]/(aX^2+bXY+cY^2-1)$ where $a,b,c\in B$. We study the smoothness of A over B, and the regularity of B when B is a ring of algebraic integers.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Bull. Math. Soc. Sci. Math. Roumanie, 57 (2014), 271-277

entry.title: The stable set of associated prime ideals of a squarefree principal Borel ideal
entry.summary: It is shown that a squarefree principal Borel ideal satisfies the persistence property for the associated prime ideals. For the graded maximal ideal we compute the index of stability with respect to squarefree principal Borel ideals and determine their stable set of associated prime ideals.

entry.title: Separating invariants for arbitrary linear actions of the additive group
entry.summary: We consider an arbitrary representation of the additive group over a field of characteristic zero and give an explicit description of a finite separating set in the corresponding ring of invariants.

entry.title: The unicity of real Picard-Vessiot fields
entry.summary: The unicity of real Picard-Vessiot fields for differential modules over a real differential field is proved.

entry.title: Graded integral closures
entry.summary: It is investigated how graded variants of integral and complete integral closures behave under coarsening functors and under formation of group algebras.
entry.arxiv:comment: to appear in Beitr\"age Algebra Geom.; typos corrected

entry.title: Ascent properties for derived functors
entry.summary: Given a flat local ring homomorphism R\to S, and two finitely generated R-modules M and N, we describe conditions under which the modules Tor^i(M,N) and Ext^i(M,N) have S-module structures that are compatible with their R-module structures.

entry.title: On codimension-one $\mathbb A^1$-fibration with retraction
entry.summary: In this paper we prove some results on the sufficiency of codimension-one fibre conditions for a flat algebra with a retraction to be locally $\mathbb{A}^1$ or at least an $\mathbb{A}^1$-fibration.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Journal of Commutative Algebra, Vol. 3, No. 2, 2011

entry.title: Polyhedral structures on tropical varieties
entry.summary: Tropical varieties are polyhedral shadows of classical varieties. The purpose of these expository notes is to explain the origin of this polyhedral complex structure from the perspective of Gr\"obner bases. To appear in the proceedings of the 2011 Bellairs Workshop in Number Theory.

entry.title: The Regularity of the Conductor
entry.summary: We bound the Castelnuovo-Mumford regularity and syzygies of the ideal of the singular set of a plane curve, and more generally of the conductor scheme of certain projectively Gorenstein varieties.

entry.title: Generalized ideal transforms
entry.summary: We study basic properties of the generalized ideal transforms $D_I(M, N)$ and the set of associated primes of the modules $R^iD_I(M,N).$

entry.title: The projective dimension of codimension two algebra presented by quadrics
entry.summary: We prove a sharp upper bound for the projective dimension of ideals of height two generated by quadrics in a polynomial ring with arbitrary large number of variables.

entry.title: Computing families of Cohen-Macaulay and Gorenstein rings
entry.summary: We characterize Cohen-Macaulay and Gorenstein rings obtained from certain types of convex body semigroups. Algorithmic methods to check if a polygonal or circle semigroup is Cohen-Macaulay/Gorenstein are given. We also provide some families of Cohen-Macaulay and Gorenstein rings.

entry.title: Numerical semigroups problem list
entry.summary: We propose a list of open problems in numerical semigroups.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in the CIM Bulletin, number 33. (http://www.cim.pt/) 13 pages

entry.title: Prime Submodules And A Sheaf On The Prime Spectra Of Modules
entry.summary: We define and investigate a sheaf of modules on the prime spectra of modules and it is shown that there is an isomorphism between the sections of this sheaf and the ideal transform module.

entry.title: On the resolution of path ideals of cycles
entry.summary: We give a formula to compute all the top degree graded Betti numbers of the path ideal of a cycle. Also we will find a criterion to determine when Betti numbers of this ideal are non zero and give a formula to compute its projective dimension and regularity.

entry.title: On the unit group of a commutative group ring
entry.summary: We investigate the group of normalized units of the group algebra $\mathbb{Z}_{p^e}G$ of a finite abelian $p$-group $G$ over the ring $\mathbb{Z}_{p^e}$ of residues modulo $p^e$ with $e\geq 1$.

entry.title: Locally principal ideals and finite character
entry.summary: It is well-known that if R is a domain with finite character, each locally principal nonzero ideal of R is invertible. We address the problem of understanding when the converse is true and survey some recent results.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Bull. Math. Soc. Sci. Math. Roumanie (N.S.), Tome 56 (104) 2013, 99-108

entry.title: The M-Principal Graph of a Commutative Ring
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author because there are some typos in proofs.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn by the author because there are some typos in proofs

entry.title: Graver degrees are not polynomially bounded by true circuit degrees
entry.summary: Let $I_A$ be a toric ideal. We prove that the degrees of the elements of the Graver basis of $I_A$ are not polynomially bounded by the true degrees of the circuits of $I_A$.

entry.title: Irreducible Jacobian derivations in positive characteristic
entry.summary: We prove that an irreducible polynomial derivation in positive characteristic is a Jacobian derivation if and only if there exists an n-1-element p-basis of its ring of constants. In the case of two variables we characterize these derivations in terms of their divergence and some nontrivial constants.

entry.title: Relative Homology and Gorenstein Flat Dimension
entry.summary: We use the machinery of relative homological algebra to study modules of finite Gorenstein flat dimension.

entry.title: Stillman's Question for Exterior Algebras
entry.summary: Let K be any field and consider exterior algebras of a finite dimensional K-vector space. In this very short paper we exhibit principal quadric ideals in a family whose Castelnuovo Mumford regularity is unbounded.

entry.title: A new characterization of Cohen-Macaulay rings
entry.summary: The purpose of this article is to provide a new characterization of Cohen-Macaulay local rings. As a consequence we deduce that a local (Noetherian) ring $R$ is Gorenstein if and only if every parameter ideal of $R$ is irreducible.

entry.title: Splitting tower and degree of tt-rings
entry.summary: After constructing a splitting tower for separable commutative ring objects in tensor-triangulated categories, we define and study their degree.
entry.arxiv:comment: 11 pages. Slight modifications in v2, to appear in Algebra and Number Theory

entry.title: Generalisations of the tame automorphisms over a domain of positive characteristic
entry.summary: In this paper, we introduce two generalizations of the tame subgroup of the automorphism group of a polynomial ring over a domain of positive characteristic. We study detailed structures of these new `tame subgroups' in the case of two variables.

entry.title: On the Characterization of f-Ideals
entry.summary: In this paper, we give the complete characterization of f-ideals of degree d greater or equal to 2.
entry.arxiv:comment: to appear in Communications in Algebra

entry.title: Some closure operations in Zariski-Riemann spaces of valuation domains: a survey
entry.summary: In this survey we present several results concerning various topologies that were introduced in recent years on spaces of valuation domains.

entry.title: Upper bound of multiplicity of F-rational rings and F-pure rings
entry.summary: This paper answers in the affirmative a question raised by Karl Schwede concerning an upper bound on the multiplicity of F-pure rings.

entry.title: Desingularization of regular algebras
entry.summary: We identify families of commutative rings that can be written as a direct limit of a directed system of noetherian regular rings and investigate the homological properties of such rings.

entry.title: Extremal Betti numbers of some classes of binomial edge ideals
entry.summary: Let $G$ be a cycle or a complete bipartite graph. We show that the binomial edge ideal $J_{G}$ and its initial ideal with respect to the lexicographic order have the same extremal Betti number.

entry.title: Monomial ideals with primary components given by powers of monomial prime ideals
entry.summary: We characterize monomial ideals which are intersections of monomial prime ideals and study classes of ideals with this property, among them polymatroidal ideals.

entry.title: On the Betti numbers of some classes of Binomial edge ideals
entry.summary: We study the Betti numbers of binomial edge ideal associated to some classes of graphs with large Castelnuovo-Mumford regularity. As an application we give several lower bounds of the Castelnuovo-Mumford regularity of arbitrary graphs depending on induced subgraphs.

entry.title: Initial ideals of Borel type
entry.summary: In this paper we use some results related to regularity, Betti numbers and reduction of generic initial ideals, showing their stability in passing from an ideal to its initial ideal if the last has some simple properties.

entry.title: Koszul binomial edge ideals
entry.summary: It is shown that if the binomial edge ideal of a graph $G$ defines a Koszul algebra, then $G$ must be chordal and claw free. A converse of this statement is proved for a class of chordal and claw free graphs.

entry.title: Polarization of Koszul cycles with applications to powers of edge ideals of whisker graphs
entry.summary: In this paper, we introduced the polarization of Koszul cycles and use it to study the depth function of powers of edge ideals of whisker graphs.

entry.title: Computing 2-Dimensional Algebras: Crossed Modules and Cat1-Algebras
entry.summary: In this paper, we described the GAP implementation of crossed modules of commutative algebras and cat$^{1}$-algebras and their equivalence.

entry.title: The intermediate value theorem over a non-Archimedean field via Hensel's Lemma
entry.summary: The paper proves that all power series over a maximal ordered Cauchy complete non-Archimedean field satisfy the intermediate value theorem on every closed interval. Hensel's Lemma for restricted power series is the main tool of the proof.

entry.title: A Separated Cohomologically Complete Module is Complete
entry.summary: We prove two theorems on cohomologically complete complexes. These theorems are inspired by, and yield an alternative proof of, a recent theorem of P. Schenzel on complete modules.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages. Final version, to appear in Comm. Algebra

entry.title: A Koszul filtration for the second squarefree Veronese subring
entry.summary: The second squarefree Veronese subring in $n$ variables is the edge ring of the complete graph with $n$ vertices. It is proved that every second squarefree Veronese subring possesses a Koszul filtration.

entry.title: Positive Integer Powers OF Symmetric(0,1)-Heptadiagonal Matrix
entry.summary: In this paper, we derive a general expression for mth powers of symmetric(0,1)-heptadiagonal matrices with n = 3k order,k = 1,2,3,...,n/3).

entry.title: Decompositions of Betti diagrams of powers of monomial ideals: A stability conjecture
entry.summary: We state a conjecture on the stability of Betti diagrams of powers of monomial ideals.
entry.arxiv:comment: Extended abstract for Combinatorial Metods in Topology and Algebra - COMETA 2013, 4 pp

entry.title: A result on Macaulay's curve
entry.summary: We are able to improve what is known about two assumed homogeneous polynomials cutting out Macaulay's curve $C_4\subseteq P^3_k$ set-theoretically, in characteristic zero. We use local cohomology and an idea from Thoma.

entry.title: The Differential Dimension Polynomial for Characterizable Differential Ideals
entry.summary: We generalize the differential dimension polynomial from prime differential ideals to characterizable differential ideals. Its computation is algorithmic, its degree and leading coefficient remain differential birational invariants, and it decides equality of characterizable differential ideals contained in each other.

entry.title: Castelnuovo-Mumford Regularity And Segre-Veronese Transform
entry.summary: In this paper we give a nice formula for the Castelnuovo-Mumford regularity of the Segre product of modules, under some suitable hypotheses. This extends recent results of David A. Cox, and Evgeny Materov (2009).

entry.title: A note on the regularity of Hibi rings
entry.summary: We compute the regularity of the Hibi ring of any finite distributive lattice in terms of its poset of join irreducible elements.

entry.title: Fields with almost small absolute Galois group
entry.summary: We construct and study fields F with the property that F has infinitely many extensions of some fixed degree, but E*/(E*)^n is finite for every finite extension E of F and every n>0.

entry.title: The algebraic theory of valued fields
entry.summary: In this exposition we discuss the theory of algebraic extensions of valued fields. Our approach is mostly through Galois theory. Most of the results are well-known, but some are new. No previous knowledge on the theory of valuations is needed.

entry.title: The second Hilbert coefficients and the sectional genera of ideals
entry.summary: This paper gives an upper bound of the second Hilbert coefficients ${\mathrm{e}}_2(I)$ of $\mathfrak{m}$-primary ideals $I$ in a Cohen-Macaulay local ring $(A,{\mathfrak{m}})$ in terms of the sectional genera of $I$.

entry.title: Stanley depth of monomial ideals
entry.summary: Let $I\supsetneq J$ be two monomial ideals of a polynomial algebra over a field generated in degree $\geq d$, resp. $\geq d+1$ . We study when the Stanley Conjecture holds for $I/J$ using the recent result of \cite{IKM} concerning the polarization.

entry.title: Stanley depth of weakly polymatroidal ideals
entry.summary: Let $\mathbb{K}$ be a field and $S=\mathbb{K}[x_1,\dots,x_n]$ be the polynomial ring in $n$ variables over the field $\mathbb{K}$. In this paper, it is shown that Stanley's conjecture holds for $S/I$, if $I$ is a weakly polymatroidal ideal.

entry.title: Koszul hypersurfaces over the exterior algebras
entry.summary: We prove that if $E$ is an exterior algebra over a field, $h$ is a quadratic form, then $E/(h)$ is Koszul if and only if $h$ is a product of two linear forms.

entry.title: Prime filtrations of the powers of an ideal
entry.summary: We prove that for all $n$, simultaneously, we can choose prime filtrations of $R/I^n$ such that the set of primes appearing in these filtrations is finite.

entry.title: Hilbert-Kunz functions of a Hirzebruch surface
entry.summary: Here we compute Hilbert-Kunz functions of any nontrivial ruled surface over ${\bf P}^1_k$, with respect to all ample line bundles on it.
entry.arxiv:comment: 20 pages, further minor revisions, more detailed explanations

entry.title: Upper semi-continuity of the Hilbert-Kunz multiplicity
entry.summary: We prove that the Hilbert-Kunz multiplicity is upper semi-continuous in F-finite rings and algebras of essentially finite type over an excellent local ring.

entry.title: Noncoherent initial ideals in exterior algebras
entry.summary: We construct a noncoherent initial ideal of an ideal in the exterior algebra of order 6, answering a question of D. Maclagan (2000). We also give a method for constructing noncoherent initial ideals in exterior algebras using certain noncoherent term orders.

entry.title: Powers of edge ideals of regularity three bipartite graphs
entry.summary: In this paper we prove that if $I(G)$ is a bipartite edge ideal with regularity three then for all $s\geq 2$ the regularity of $I(G)^s$ is exactly $2s+1$.

entry.title: Euler class group of a Noetherian ring
entry.summary: We will study the Euler class group of a commutative Noetherian ring $A$ of dimension $d$, developed by S.M. Bhatwadekar and Raja Sridharan. This is my M.Phil thesis from 2001.

entry.title: The coordinate ring of a simple polyomino
entry.summary: In this paper it is shown that a polyomino is balanced if and only if it is simple. As a consequence one obtains that the coordinate ring of a simple polyomino is a normal Cohen-Macaulay domain.

entry.title: Hochster's small MCM conjecture for three-dimensional weakly F-split rings
entry.summary: We prove Hochster's small MCM conjecture for three-dimensional complete F-pure rings. We deduce this from a more general criterion, and show that only a weakening of the notion of F-purity is needed, to wit, being weakly F-split. We conjecture that any complete ring is weakly F-split.

entry.title: Ideals defining Gorenstein rings are (almost) never products
entry.summary: This note proves that if S is an unramified regular local ring and I and J are proper ideals of height at least two, then S/IJ is never Gorenstein.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proc. Amer. Math. Soc., vol 135, (2007), pages 2003-2005

entry.title: The saturation of Frobenius powers of ideals
entry.summary: This paper proves some special cases in which localization of tight closure holds. In particular it studies the condition LC relating to bounding the Loewy lengths of local cohomology of Frobenius iterates of quotient rings.

entry.title: Special tight closure
entry.summary: We prove that in normal rings the tight closure of an ideal can be computed as the sum of the ideal and a piece of the tight closure, called the special tight closure.

entry.title: Hilbert-Kunz multiplicities and the F-signature
entry.summary: This is a survey article on Hilbert-Kunz multiplicity and the F-signature.
entry.arxiv:comment: This article appears in a Springer volume edited by Irena Peeva, "Commutative Algebra: Expository Papers Dedicated to David Eisenbud on the Occasion of his 65th Birthday"

entry.title: Frobenius Splitting in Commutative Algebra
entry.summary: This is a survey of Frobenius splitting techniques in commutative algebra, based on the first author's lectures at the introductory workshop for the special year in commutative algebra at MSRI in fall 2012.

entry.title: $F$-singularities: applications of characteristic $p$ methods to singularity theory
entry.summary: This is a survey article on $F$-singularities and their applications.
entry.arxiv:comment: 41 pages, to appear in Sugaku Expositions; v2: references added

entry.title: The norm map of Witt vectors
entry.summary: We discuss a multiplicative version of the Verschiebung map of Witt vectors that we call the norm.

entry.title: The Groebner basis of a polynomial system
entry.summary: We compute the Groebner basis of a system of polynomial equations related to the Jacobian conjecture using a recursive formula for the Catalan numbers.
entry.arxiv:comment: From the Magister Thesis of Marco Solorzano

entry.title: On a topological characterization of prüfer v-multiplication domains among essential domains
entry.summary: In this paper we characterize the Pr\"ufer v-multiplication domain as a class of essential domains verifying an additional property on the closure of some families of prime ideals, with respect to the constructible topology.

entry.title: Semidualizing DG Modules over Tensor Products
entry.summary: We study the existence of nontrivial semidualizing DG modules over tensor products of DG algebras over a field. In particular, this gives a lower bound on the number of semidualizing DG modules over the tensor product.

entry.title: On existence of canonical $G$-bases
entry.summary: We describe a general method for expanding a truncated G-iterative Hasse-Schmidt derivation, where G is an algebraic group. We give examples of algebraic groups for which our method works.

entry.title: Partial regularities and $a^*$-invariants of Borel type ideals
entry.summary: We express the Partial regularities and $a^*$-invariants of a Borel type ideal in terms of its irredundant irreducible decomposition. In addition we consider the behaviours of those invariants under intersections and sums.

entry.title: On Two Classes of Regular Sequences
entry.summary: In this paper we get two new classes of regular sequences in the polynomial ring over the field of complex numbers.

entry.title: Determining cyclicity of finite modules
entry.summary: We present a deterministic polynomial-time algorithm that determines whether a finite module over a finite commutative ring is cyclic, and if it is, outputs a generator.
entry.arxiv:comment: to appear in Journal of Symbolic Computation

entry.title: Gorenstein modules and Auslander categories
entry.summary: In this paper, some new characterizations on Gorenstein projective, injective and flat modules over commutative noetherian local ring are given.

entry.title: A test for monomial containment
entry.summary: We present an algorithm to decide whether a given ideal in the polynomial ring contains a monomial without using Gr\"obner bases, factorization or sub-resultant computations.

entry.title: Invariants of commuting matrices
entry.summary: We comment two papers of Domokos and Vaccarino proving that the restriction to diagonal matrices of the scheme of commuting matrices is an isomorphism when restricted to invariants to the symmetric group invariants.

entry.title: The Hilbert series of the ring associated to an almost alternating matrix
entry.summary: We give an explicit formula for the Hilbert Series of an algebra defined by a linearly presented, standard graded, residual intersection of a grade three Gorenstein ideal.

entry.title: Nonsimple polyominoes and prime ideals
entry.summary: It is known that the polyomino ideal of a simple polyomino is a prime ideal. A new class of nonsimple polyominoes $\Pc$ for which the polyomino ideal $I_{\Pc}$ is a prime ideal will be presented.

entry.title: Some more combinatorics results on Nagata extensions
entry.summary: We show that lengths of ring extensions are preserved under the formation of Nagata extensions as well as Dobbs-Mullins invariant. We exhibit a new condition for the FIP property be preserved under the formation of Nagata extensions by using arithmetic extensions of rings.

entry.title: Binomial vanishing ideals
entry.summary: In this paper we characterize, in algebraic and geometric terms, when a graded vanishing ideal is generated by binomials over any field K.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: J. Algebra Comb. Discrete Appl. 2 (2015), no. 2, 77--82

entry.title: Toric rings of nonsimple polyominoes
entry.summary: It is known that toric ring of a simple polyomino is ring homomorphic to a edge ring of a weakly chordal bipartite graph. In this paper we identify the toric ring of nonsimple polyominoes which are of the form "rectangle minus rectangle".

entry.title: A Note on Darboux Polynomials of Monomial Derivations
entry.summary: We study a monomial derivation $d$ proposed by J. Moulin Ollagnier and A. Nowicki in the polynomial ring of four variables, and prove that $d$ has no Darboux polynomials if and only if $d$ has a trivial field of constants.

entry.title: Delta sets for numerical semigroups with embedding dimension three
entry.summary: We present a fast algorithm to compute the Delta set of a nonsymmetric numerical semigroups with embedding dimension three.

entry.title: Waldschmidt constants for Stanley-Reisner ideals of a class of Simplicial Complexes
entry.summary: We study the symbolic powers of the Stanley-Reisner ideal $I_{B_n}$ of a bipyramid $B_n$ over a $n-$gon $Q_n$. Using a combinatorial approach, based on analysis of subtrees in $Q_n$ we compute the Waldschmidt constant of $I_{B_n}$.

entry.title: The common-submatrix Laplace expansion
entry.summary: We state and prove a classical version of the Laplace expansion theorem where all submatrices in the expansion are restricted to contain a specified common submatrix (CSM). The result states that (accounting for signs) this restricted expansion equals the determinant of the original matrix times the determinant of the CSM.

entry.title: Connection between commutative algebra and topology
entry.summary: The main aim of this paper to show how commutative algebra is connected to topology. We give underlying topological idea of some results on completable unimodular rows.

entry.title: Trace map and regularity of finite extensions of a DVR
entry.summary: We interpret the regularity of a finite and flat extension of a discrete valuation ring in terms of the trace map of the extension.

entry.title: On Frobenius numbers for Symmetric (not Complete Intersection) Semigroups Generated by Four Elements
entry.summary: We derive the lower bound for Frobenius number of symmetric (not complete intersection) semigroups generated by four elements.

entry.title: Errata: On the Homology of Completion and Torsion
entry.summary: In this note we correct two errors in our paper "On the Homology of Completion and Torsion", arXiv:1010.4386, that appeared in Algebras and Representation Theory (2014).

entry.title: On the type of an almost Gorenstein monomial curve
entry.summary: We prove that the Cohen-Macaulay type of an almost Gorenstein monomial curve $\mathcal C \subseteq \mathbb{A}^4$ is at most $3$, and make some considerations on the general case.

entry.title: A case study of Gröbner bases and Hilbert series
entry.summary: In this expository style of writing I will give an introduction of Gr\"{o}bner bases and compute it for some algebras and then show how to use it to compute Hilbert series for algebras from chains.

entry.title: A Study of Quasi-Gorenstein Rings
entry.summary: In this paper several quasi-Gorenstein counterparts to some known properties of Gorenstein rings are given. We, furthermore, give an explicit description of the attach prime ideals of certain local cohomology modules.

entry.title: Existence of Dicritical Divisors Revisited
entry.summary: We characterize the diacriticals of special pencils. We also initiate higher dimensional dicritical theory.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proc. Indian Acad. Sci. vol 121 (2011) pp. 267-290

entry.title: Translates of Polynomials
entry.summary: Let f = 0 be a hypersurface in n-dimensional affine space over a field k. We consider the pencil of hypersurfaces f- c = 0 with c varying over k.

entry.title: On the Intermediate Value Theorem over a Valued Field
entry.summary: The paper proves the intermediate value theorem for polynomials and power series over a valued field with divisible valuation group and infinite residue field. Some further results on the behaviour of the valuation are obtained using Hensel's Lemma.

entry.title: Counting Square free Cremona monomial maps
entry.summary: We use combinatorics tools to reobtain the classification of monomial quadratic Cremona transformations in any number of variables given in \cite{SV2} and to classify and count square free cubic Cremona maps with at most six variables, up to isomorphism.

entry.title: Computing Quasidegrees of A-graded Modules
entry.summary: We describe the main functions of the Macaulay2 package Quasidegrees. The purpose of this package is to compute the quasidegree set of a finitely generated A-graded module presented as the cokernel of a monomial matrix. We provide examples with motivation coming from A-hypergeometric systems.

entry.title: Toric representations of algebras defined by certain nonsimple polyominoes
entry.summary: In this paper we give a toric representation of the associated ring of a polyomino which is obtained by removing a convex polyomino from its ambient rectangle.

entry.title: Artin approximation property and the General Neron Desingularization
entry.summary: This is an exposition on the General Neron Desingularization and its applications. We end with a recent constructive form of this desingularization in dimension one
entry.arxiv:comment: This is a survey written for the Contributions to the Eight-th Congress of Romanian Mathematicians, 2015

entry.title: The degree of a tropical basis
entry.summary: We give an explicit upper bound for the degree of a tropical basis of a homogeneous polynomial ideal. As an application f-vectors of tropical varieties are discussed. Various examples illustrate differences between Gr\"obner and tropical bases.

entry.title: Gram-Schmidt-Vaserstein generators for odd sized elementary groups
entry.summary: The Gram-Schmidt process of L.N. Vaserstein for making an elementary matrix symplectic yields a nice set of generators for the odd sized elementary group.

entry.title: A note on Fröberg's conjecture for forms of equal degrees
entry.summary: In this note by using elementary considerations, we settle Fr\"oberg's conjecture for a large number of cases, when all generators of ideals have the same degree.

entry.title: On the Stanley depth of the path ideal of a cycle graph
entry.summary: We give tight bounds for the Stanley depth of the quotient ring of the path ideal of a cycle graph. In particular, we prove that it satisfies the Stanley inequality.

entry.title: Weak dimension of FP-injective modules over chain rings
entry.summary: It is proven that the weak dimension of each FP-injective module over a chain ring which is either Archimedean or not semicoherent is less or equal to 2.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Communications in Algebra, Taylor & Francis, 2016, 44 (1), pp.381-389

entry.title: Nested Artin approximation
entry.summary: A short proof of the linear nested Artin approximation property of the algebraic power series rings is given here.
entry.arxiv:comment: We simplified the statements of propositions

entry.title: A new proof of the cohomological criterion for noetherian regular local rings
entry.summary: Let $(A,\mathfrak{m}, k=A/\mathfrak{m})$ be a noetherian local ring. Then it is equivalent $n = \dim A = \dim_k \mathfrak{m}/\mathfrak{m}^2$ and $\mathrm{Tor}^A_i(k,k) = 0$ for all $i \gg 0$. The article gives a proof with the change-of-ring spectral sequence.

entry.title: Isotropy of 5-dimensional quadratic forms over the function field of a quadric in characteristic 2
entry.summary: We complete a classification of quadratic forms over a field of characteristic 2 of type (1,3) that become isotropic over the function field of a quadric.

entry.title: Integral dimension of a noetherian ring
entry.summary: In this paper, we introduce a new notion, called the integral dimension, for noetherian rings. It can be regarded as the weak Briancon-Skoda numbers of rings. The point is that every noetherian local ring has finite integral dimension.

entry.title: Canonical modules of complexes
entry.summary: We define the notion of the canonical module of a complex. We then consider Serre's conditions for a complex and study their relationship to the local cohomology of the canonical module and its ring of endomorphisms.
entry.arxiv:comment: 16 pages, to appear in the Journal of Pure and Applied Algebra

entry.title: A note on the kernel of a pair of linear maps
entry.summary: The kernel of a pair of linear systems is studied in the framework of commutative ring theory with applications to behavioral perspective of linear systems

entry.title: On the sign patterns of the coefficients of Hilbert polynomials
entry.summary: We show that all sign patterns of the coefficients Hilbert polynomials of standard graded $k$-algebras are possible.

entry.title: Some Remarks on Watanabe's Bold Conjecture
entry.summary: At the 2015 Workshop on Lefschetz Properties of Artinian Algebras, Junzo Watanabe conjectured that every graded Artinian complete intersection algebra with the standard grading can be embedded into another such algebra cut out by quadratic generators. We verify this conjecture in the case where the defining polynomials split into linear factors.

entry.title: On (k,n)-closed submodules
entry.summary: Let R be a commutative ring with unity and M be an R- module In this paper we introduce semi n- absorbing and (k, n)-closed submodules of modules over commutative rings, and investigate their basic properties.

entry.title: An easy proof of the general Neron desingularization in dimension $\leq 1$
entry.summary: In this paper we give an easy proof of the general Neron desingularization in the frame of regular morphism between Artinian local rings and Noetherian local rings of dimension one.

entry.title: On the straightening law for minors of a matrix
entry.summary: We give a simple new proof for the straightening law of Doubilet, Rota, and Stein using a generalization of the Laplace expansion of a determinant.

entry.title: Hilbert-Kunz theory for binoids
entry.summary: We develop Hilbert-Kunz theory in a combinatorial setting namely for binoids. We show that the Hilbert-Kunz multiplicity for commutative, finitely generated, semipositive, cancellative and reduced binoids exists and is a rational number. This implies that the corresponding Hilbert-Kunz multiplicity for the binoid algebras does not depend on the characteristic.

entry.title: On the Davenport-Mahler bound
entry.summary: We prove that the Davenport-Mahler bound holds for arbitrary graphs with vertices on the set of roots of a given univariate polynomial with complex coefficients.

entry.title: On some factorial properties of subrings
entry.summary: We discuss various factorial properties of subrings as well as properties involving irreducible and square-free elements, in particular ones connected with Jacobian conditions.

entry.title: Some notes on spectral topologies
entry.summary: In this expository work, the Hausdorffness of the flat and Zariski topologies are completely characterized. Absolutely flat rings play a major role throughout this article.

entry.title: Globalizing F-invariants
entry.summary: In this paper we define and study the global Hilbert-Kunz multiplicity and the global F-signature of prime characteristic rings which are not necessarily local. Our techniques are made meaningful by extending many known theorems about Hilbert-Kunz multiplicity and F-signature to the non-local case.

entry.title: On the relations of isotonian algebras
entry.summary: It is shown that for large classes of posets $P$ and $Q$, the defining ideal $J_{P,Q}$ of an isotonian algebras is generated by squarefree binomials. Within these classes, those posets are classified for which $J_{P,Q}$ is quadratically generated.

entry.title: When almost Cohen-Macaulay algebras map into big Cohen-Macaulay modules
entry.summary: In this paper, we show that almost Cohen-Macaulay algebras are solid and in this respect, we seek for some special situation when (a) an almost Cohen-Macaulay algebra will be phantom extension and (b) when it maps into a balanced big Cohen-Macaulay module.

entry.title: New Strategies for Standard Bases over Z
entry.summary: Experiences with the implementation of strong Gr\"obner bases respectively standard bases for polynomial rings over principal ideal rings are explained: different strategies for creating the pair set, methods to avoid coefficient growth and a normal form algorithm for non-global orderings.

entry.title: Finite lattices and Koszul Filtrations
entry.summary: We characterize when a finite lattice is distributive by the existences of some particular classes of Koszul filtrations.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 to appear in Communications in Algebra

entry.title: Cotangent cohomology of quadratic monomial ideals
entry.summary: We study the deformation theory of quotients of polynomial rings by quadratic monomial ideals. More precisely we compute the first cotangent cohomology module of such rings. We also give a criterion for vanishing of second cotangent cohomology module.

entry.title: The Hilbert function of bigraded algebras in $k[\mathbb{P}^1\times\mathbb{P}^1]$
entry.summary: We classify the Hilbert functions of bigraded algebras in $k[x_1, x_2, y_1, y_2]$ introducing a numerical function called Ferrers function.

entry.title: The minimal resolution of a cointerval edge ideal is multiplicative
entry.summary: We show that the minimal resolution of the quotient of the polynomial algebra over a field by a cointerval edge ideal can be given the structure of a DG-algebra.

entry.title: A remark on regularity of powers and products of ideals
entry.summary: New title and minor adjustments. To appear in the Journal of Pure and Applied Algebra
entry.arxiv:comment: Dedicated to the memory of our friend Tony Geramita

entry.title: SP-rings with zero-divisors
entry.summary: We characterize the commutative rings whose ideals (resp. regular ideals) are products of radical ideals.

entry.title: An ideal-based cozero-divisor graph of a commutative ring
entry.summary: Let $R$ be a commutative ring and let $I$ be an ideal of $R$. In this paper, we introduce the cozero-divisor graph $\acute{\Gamma}_I(R)$ of $R$ and obtain some related results.

entry.title: Graded Betti numbers of I-good filtrations
entry.summary: In this work we generalize our previous results about graded Betti numbers of powers of homogenous ideals in Z-graded algebra over Notherian local ring and finally we investigate the structure of Tor module of I-good filtrations.
